December 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Media image== [[File:Anushka Sharma at the Lux Golden Rose Awards.jpg|thumb|upright|Sharma at an event for [[Lux (soap)|Lux]] in 2016]] Priya Gupta of ''The Times of India'' has said that "the best part of [Sharma's] stardom is that she does not have the trappings of a star."<ref>{{cite news|title=Anushka Sharma: Virat and I love each other for both the real and right reasons |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Anushka-Sharma-Virat-and-I-love-each-other-for-both-the-real-and-right-reasons/articleshow/47189050.cms |last=Gupta |first=Priya |work=The Times of India |date=8 May 2015 |accessdate=23 January 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150511111754/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Anushka-Sharma-Virat-and-I-love-each-other-for-both-the-real-and-right-reasons/articleshow/47189050.cms |archivedate=11 May 2015 |df= }}</ref> Kalpana Nair of ''Firstpost'' stated: "actresses like Sharma command the respect they do in a largely conservative and male-dominated industry and the fact that their fan base grows when they take on roles that are not conventional is good reason for us to beam widely and walk with a spring in our step".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.firstpost.com/bollywood/from-bubbly-actress-to-a-debutant-producer-anushka-sharma-talks-about-bollywood-biases-2142913.html |title=From bubbly actress to a debutant producer: Anushka Sharma talks about Bollywood biases |work=Firstpost |last=Nair |first=Kalpana |date=11 March 2015 |accessdate=11 June 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150612001959/http://www.firstpost.com/bollywood/from-bubbly-actress-to-a-debutant-producer-anushka-sharma-talks-about-bollywood-biases-2142913.html |archivedate=12 June 2015 |df= }}</ref> Samar Srivastava, writing for ''[[Forbes]]'', called her "unafraid", and added: "you would be hard-pressed to associate Sharma with the stereotype of a mainstream leading lady."<ref>{{cite news|title=Anushka Sharma: Hitting her stride |url=http://forbesindia.com/article/2015-celebrity-100/anushka-sharma-hitting-her-stride/41765/1 |last=Srivastava |first=Samar |work=Forbes India |date=24 December 2015 |accessdate=23 January 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160131185838/http://forbesindia.com/article/2015-celebrity-100/anushka-sharma-hitting-her-stride/41765/1 |archivedate=31 January 2016 |df= }}</ref> ''The Times of India'' published that "..she never shies away from putting [her opinion] across."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/Anushka-Sharma-5-lessons-we-learn-from-the-actress/photostory/47110115.cms |title=Anushka Sharma: 5 lessons we learn from the actress |work=The Times of India |accessdate=11 June 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150508063310/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/anushka-sharma-5-lessons-we-learn-from-the-actress/photostory/47110115.cms |archivedate= 8 May 2015 |df= }}</ref>
Sharma featured on Rediff.com's list of "Bollywood's Best Actors" for ''Band Baaja Baaraat'' (2010),<ref>{{cite web|title=Bollywood's best actresses, 2010 |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-bollywoods-best-ctresses-2010/20101231.htm#6 |publisher=Rediff.com |date=31 December 2010 |accessdate=23 September 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121025113233/http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-bollywoods-best-ctresses-2010/20101231.htm |archivedate=25 October 2012 |df= }}</ref> and ''NH10'' (2015).<ref>{{cite web|title=Sukanya Verma's Best Actresses of 2015 |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/sukanya-vermas-best-actresses-of-2015/20151224.htm |publisher=Rediff.com |date=24 December 2015 |accessdate=30 December 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160123175703/http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/sukanya-vermas-best-actresses-of-2015/20151224.htm |archivedate=23 January 2016 |df= }}</ref> She was also featured in their list of "Bollywood's Best Dressed Actresses" in 2012–13.<ref>{{cite web|title=Best dressed stars of 2012 |url=http://www.rediff.com/getahead/slide-show/slide-show-1-glamour-best-dressed-stars-of-2012/20121231.htm#5 |publisher=Rediff.com |date=31 December 2012 |accessdate=11 June 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150613052612/http://www.rediff.com/getahead/slide-show/slide-show-1-glamour-best-dressed-stars-of-2012/20121231.htm |archivedate=13 June 2015 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Bollywoods best dressed actresses of 2013 |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-bollywoods-best-dressed-actresses-of-2013/20131219.htm#6 |publisher=Rediff.com |date=19 December 2013 |accessdate=11 June 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150925040356/http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-bollywoods-best-dressed-actresses-of-2013/20131219.htm |archivedate=25 September 2015 |df= }}</ref> She held the fifth position on ''The Times of India's'' listing of the "Most Desirable Woman" in 2011.<ref>{{cite news|title=Times 50 Most Desirable Women of 2011:The Winners |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Times-50-Most-Desirable-Women-of-2011-The-Winners/articleshow/11753716.cms |work=The Times of India |date=4 February 2012 |accessdate=30 August 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150913224903/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Times-50-Most-Desirable-Women-of-2011-The-Winners/articleshow/11753716.cms |archivedate=13 September 2015 |df= }}</ref> In 2012, she appeared in the ''Forbes'' Celebrity 100, a list based on income and popularity of India's celebrities. She remained in the top fifty spots for three consecutive years, listed at the thirty-sixth spot in 2012, the thirty-first spot in 2013, and the forty-second spot in 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=2012 Celebrity 100 List — Forbes India |url=http://forbesindia.com/lists/2012-celebrity-100/1395/1 |work=[[Forbes India]] |accessdate=3 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150711071335/http://forbesindia.com/lists/2012-celebrity-100/1395/1 |archivedate=11 July 2015 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=2013 Celebrity 100 List — Forbes India |url=http://forbesindia.com/lists/2013-celebrity-100/1439/all |work=Forbes India |accessdate=8 February 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140219072752/http://forbesindia.com/lists/2013-celebrity-100/1439/all |archivedate=19 February 2014 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=2014 Celebrity 100 List -Forbes India |url=http://forbesindia.com/lists/2014-celebrity-100/1489/1 |work=Forbes India |accessdate=24 June 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150711071333/http://forbesindia.com/lists/2014-celebrity-100/1489/1 |archivedate=11 July 2015 |df= }}</ref> In 2015, she was ranked nineteenth with an estimated annual earning of {{INRConvert|26.83|c}}, making her one of the highest-paid actresses in the country.<ref>{{cite news|title=2015 Celebrity 100 List — Forbes India |url=http://forbesindia.com/lists/2015-celebrity-100/1519/all |work=Forbes India |accessdate=12 December 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151213102627/http://forbesindia.com/lists/2015-celebrity-100/1519/all |archivedate=13 December 2015 |df= }}</ref> Sharma maintaines a Twitter account and has an official Facebook page. She is cited as one of the most popular Indian celebrities on social media.<ref>{{cite web|title=Top 11 most popular Bollywood stars on social media |url=http://www.indiatvnews.com/entertainment/bollywood/top-10-most-popular-bollywood-stars-on-social-media-22256.html |publisher=[[India TV]] |accessdate=28 September 2015 |date=24 June 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150928031214/http://www.indiatvnews.com/entertainment/bollywood/top-10-most-popular-bollywood-stars-on-social-media-22256.html |archivedate=28 September 2015 |df= }}</ref> In 2015, she appeared on ''The Huffington Post''{{'}}s list of "100 most influential women on Twitter".<ref>{{cite news|title=Priyanka Chopra Named Most Influential Indian Woman on Twitter |url=http://www.indiawest.com/entertainment/bollywood/priyanka-chopra-named-most-influential-indian-woman-on-twitter/article_b8b6e1c2-11a3-11e5-abad-cf97415727a8.html |work=India-West |date=13 June 2015 |accessdate=14 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Zk2UN2PN?url=http://www.indiawest.com/entertainment/bollywood/priyanka-chopra-named-most-influential-indian-woman-on-twitter/article_b8b6e1c2-11a3-11e5-abad-cf97415727a8.html |archivedate= 3 July 2015 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}</ref> The same year, she also topped the [[Times Celebex: Bollywood Stars' Rating|Times Celebex]] list of Bollywood stars, in terms of highest box-office collection.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/times-celebex-pk-stars-aamir-khan-anushka-sharma-beat-shah-rukh-khan-deepika-padukone-top-list-622452 |title=Times Celebex: 'PK' Stars Aamir Khan-Anushka Sharma Beat Shah Rukh Khan-Deepika Padukone to Top List |publisher=International Business Times |last=Sen |first=Sushmita |date=5 February 2015 |accessdate=29 June 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150701135400/http://www.ibtimes.co.in/times-celebex-pk-stars-aamir-khan-anushka-sharma-beat-shah-rukh-khan-deepika-padukone-top-list-622452 |archivedate= 1 July 2015 |df= }}</ref> In 2016, she featured on ''The Times of India'' 's 'Most Engaging on Twitter' list of Hindi film actors.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Shah-Rukh-Khan-and-Priyanka-Chopra-are-Most-Engaging-Bollywood-stars-on-The-Times-Twitter-Impact-List/articleshow/51108065.cms?from=mdr|title=Shah Rukh Khan and Priyanka Chopra are 'Most Engaging' Bollywood stars on The Times Twitter Impact List|work=The Times of India|date=24 February 2016|accessdate=27 February 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180311001846/https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Shah-Rukh-Khan-and-Priyanka-Chopra-are-Most-Engaging-Bollywood-stars-on-The-Times-Twitter-Impact-List/articleshow/51108065.cms?from=mdr|archivedate=11 March 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> ''Filmfare'' magazine's fashion poll of 2015 voted her as being "Amazing with Androgyny" and said that "...[she] has carved a niche for her easy breezy high street style."<ref>{{cite news|title=Filmfare fashion poll 2015 |url=http://www.filmfare.com/features/filmfare-fashion-poll-2015_-10853-11.html#descArticle |last=Rathod |first=Kinnari |work=Filmfare |date=16 October 2015 |accessdate=19 October 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151208094949/http://www.filmfare.com/features/filmfare-fashion-poll-2015_-10853-11.html |archivedate= 8 December 2015 |df= }}</ref> She also featured on ''[[Verve (magazine)|Verve]]'' magazine's "Best Dressed 2015" list.<ref>{{cite news|title=Best Dressed 2015: Anushka Sharma |url=http://www.vervemagazine.in/people/indias-best-dressed-2015-anushka-sharma-style |work=[[Verve (magazine)|Verve]] |date=8 December 2015 |accessdate=12 December 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151222120606/http://www.vervemagazine.in/people/indias-best-dressed-2015-anushka-sharma-style |archivedate=22 December 2015 |df= }}</ref> In 2018, Sharma appeared in the ''Forbes'' Asia 30 Under 30 List and was the only Bollywood celebrity listed for the year.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/30-under-30-asia/2018/entertainment-sports/#33487c73551d|title=30 Under 30 Asia 2018: Entertainment & Sports|website=Forbes|access-date=2018-03-30|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180331041513/https://www.forbes.com/30-under-30-asia/2018/entertainment-sports/#33487c73551d|archivedate=31 March 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Sharma is a celebrity endorser for various brands and products, including [[TVS Scooty]], [[Nivea]], [[Elle (magazine)|Elle 18 cosmetics]], [[Instant coffee|Bru coffee]] and [[Pantene]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Gen-next Bollywood actors: the hottest new players in ad world|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Tabloid/Gen-next-Bollywood-actors-the-hottest-new-players-in-ad-world/Article1-1038359.aspx|author=Awaasthi, Kavita|work=Hindustan Times|date=6 April 2013|accessdate=6 April 2013|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510223605/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Tabloid/Gen-next-Bollywood-actors-the-hottest-new-players-in-ad-world/Article1-1038359.aspx|archivedate=10 May 2013}}</ref>

revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2011}} {{Infobox Officeholder | name =Bill Thomas | image = | imagesize =220px | smallimage = | caption = | order = | office = | state_house =Alaska | state =Alaska | district =5th | term_start =January 10, 2005 | term_end =January 14, 2013 | president = | predecessor =[[Albert Kookesh]] | successor =[[Jonathan Kreiss-Tomkins]]Following redistricting, the existing 5th District was abolished. Kreiss-Tomkins succeeds Thomas as representative of the 34th District by virtue of that district containing 11 of the 17 precincts of the former 5th District, as well as Thomas running for reelection in the 34th District during the [[Alaska elections, 2012|2012 election]]. | order2 = | term_start2 = | term_end2 = | predecessor2 = | successor2 = | birth_date ={{birth date and age|1947|6|1}} | birth_place =[[Haines, Alaska|Haines]], [[Territory of Alaska]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = | party =[[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] | spouse =Joyce Marie Thomas | relations = | children =Rhett,
Danny,
Gabriel,
Cole,
Rhiannon | residence =Haines, Alaska | alma_mater =[[University of Alaska Fairbanks|University of Alaska]] | occupation = | profession =Commercial fisherman | religion = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} '''William A. "Bill" Thomas Jr.''' (born June 1, 1947) is a businessman, commercial fisherman, and politician from the U.S. state of Alaska. Thomas served as a [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] member of the [[Alaska House of Representatives]] from the 5th District, comprising scattered rural and semi-rural communities throughout [[Southeast Alaska]] and stretching westward to [[Prince William Sound]], from 2005 to 2013. Thomas served in the majority his entire tenure in the House and held multiple chairmanships. Thomas gained a seat on the powerful House Finance Committee during his second term and would eventually co-chair the committee. Following [[redistricting]], Thomas lost reelection [[Alaska elections, 2012|in 2012]] by 32 votes to 23-year-old [[Jonathan Kreiss-Tomkins]], a political newcomer who left [[Yale University]] to run. ==Early life== William A. Thomas Jr. was born in [[Haines, Alaska|Haines]], [[Territory of Alaska]] on June 1, 1947, and is a lifelong resident of Haines and the surrounding [[Chilkat River|Chilkat Valley]]. He is descended from the [[Tlingit people|Tlingit]] Natives of nearby [[Klukwan]] village. Speaking before a Native organization in Juneau about his origins, Thomas once explained "And the Thomas? That came from [[California]]". Bill Thomas graduated from [[Haines High School]] in 1965. Shortly thereafter, he briefly attended the [[University of Alaska Fairbanks|University of Alaska]] before joining the U.S. Army, where he served for two years during the Vietnam War.{{cite web|url=http://house.legis.state.ak.us/rep.php?id=thm |title=The Alaska State Legislature |publisher=House.legis.state.ak.us |date=June 1, 1947 |accessdate=September 20, 2011}} ==Business career== Bill Thomas began commercial fishing for a living ca. 1970, and has continued in this line of work ever since. He has mostly run gillnets and longlines.{{cite web |url=http://housemajority.org/thomas/index.php?p=bio |title=Rep. Thomas's Biography – 27th AK Legislature House Majority |publisher=Housemajority.org |accessdate=September 20, 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110924203550/http://housemajority.org/thomas/index.php?p=bio |archive-date=September 24, 2011 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }} Thomas has also served as chairman and CEO of his village's Native corporate, Klukwan, Inc. This position has led to Thomas serving on the board of directors of a number of the corporation's subsidiaries. ==Political career== ===Early political career=== Bill Thomas began working as a [[lobbyist]] in Juneau ca. 1991, mostly representing small community concerns throughout Southeast Alaska. He also spent four years apiece on the [[Haines Borough]] assembly (legislative body) and school board. In 2004, Democrat [[Georgianna Lincoln]], who represented the sprawling, rural District C in the [[Alaska Senate]] (Lincoln hailed from the [[Yukon River]] village of [[Rampart, Alaska|Rampart]]), did not seek reelection. 5th District member of the [[Alaska House of Representatives]], [[Albert Kookesh]], filed to run for the Senate, eventually winning. Thomas ran for the 5th District House seat, citing his experience as a lobbyist as being beneficial to the position. Thomas won election in 2004 by 59 votes over Tim June, a fellow commercial fisherman from Haines, who was active in environmental and watershed issues for many years. Thomas would be reelected mostly easily thereafter, including defeating June by an approximately 61 to 38 percent margin in 2008. ===Alaska House of Representatives=== ====24th Alaska State Legislature==== In the [[24th Alaska State Legislature]], Thomas served as co-chair of the House Community and Regional Affairs Committee, as well as co-chair of the Fisheries Committee. He also served on the Education, Military and Veterans' Affairs and the Transportation Committees in the House. ;2007-2008 *Member, Finance Committee ;2005-2006 *Commerce, Community & Economic Development *Fish & Game *Transportation ;2007-2008 *Chair, Administration *Chair, Fish & Game since 2004.{{cite web|url=http://ballotpedia.org/wiki/index.php/Bill_Thomas |title=Bill Thomas |publisher=Ballotpedia |accessdate=September 20, 2011}} He served as Co-Chair of the Finance Committee and was a member of the Legislative Budget & Audit Committee. He also chaired the Governor and the Legislature Finance Subcommittees for the 27th Legislature.{{cite web |url=http://housemajority.org/thomas/index.php |title=Rep. Bill Thomas – 27th AK Legislature House Majority |publisher=Housemajority.org |accessdate=September 20, 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110924202626/http://www.housemajority.org/thomas/index.php |archive-date=September 24, 2011 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }} ===2012 election loss=== Due to an Alaskan Supreme Court order, the redistricting board has redrawn the district lines for the 2012 election based on state constitutional requirements. Major changes have been proposed to the Southeast region, including Thomas's district.{{cite web|title=Redistricting board redraws southeast Alaska|url=http://www.mysanantonio.com/news/article/Redistricting-board-redraws-southeast-Alaska-3557894.php|publisher=mysanantonio.com|accessdate=20 May 2012|author=BECKY BOHRER|date=May 14, 2012}}{{dead link|date=July 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite web|title=Redistricting board unveils boundary changes for Southeast|url=http://www.adn.com/2012/05/14/2464675/redistricting-board-redraws-southeast.html|publisher=Anchorage Daily News|accessdate=20 May 2012|author=BECKY BOHRER|date=May 15, 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120518103050/http://www.adn.com/2012/05/14/2464675/redistricting-board-redraws-southeast.html|archivedate=May 18, 2012|df=mdy-all}} The proposed plan combines the 5th District with Juneau, the state capital directly to the south. Constituents from [[Haines Borough, Alaska|Haines Borough]] have objected to the new map, town mayor Stephanie Scott stated "we do not believe that we are socio-economically integrated with the Mendenhall Valley, we don't have the same concerns, the same needs."{{cite web|title=Haines objects to capital city link: Juneau's northern neighbor fears being 'swallowed up' in new legislative district|url=http://juneauempire.com/local/2012-05-20/haines-objects-capital-city-link#.T7l3FMXLL3A|publisher=Juneau Empire|accessdate=20 May 2012|author=Pat Forgey|date=May 20, 2012}} [[Jonathan Kreiss-Tomkins]] of [[Sitka, Alaska|Sitka]] was the Democratic challenger to Thomas. Kreiss-Tomkins subsequently defeated Thomas by 32 votes, following a recount. As ballot-counting continued beyond election day, the lead went back and forth, even tying at one point.{{cite web|last=Miller|first=Mark|title=Kreiss-Tomkins wins seat by 32 votes|url=http://juneauempire.com/state/2012-12-03/kreiss-tomkins-wins-seat-32-votes#.UQxwclo3lL8|publisher=Juneau Empire|accessdate=2 February 2013}} ==Personal life== Bill Thomas and his wife, Joyce Marie, have five children: Rhett, Danny, Gabriel, Cole and Rhiannon. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090620224406/http://www.housemajority.org/thomas/index.php Alaska State House Majority Site for Rep. Bill Thomas] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20120930005132/http://housemajority.org/feeds.php?rss=rep39 House Majority Site RSS Feed for Rep. Bill Thomas] * [https://www.facebook.com/RepresentativeBillThomasNewsAndUpdates?ref=hl Legislative Facebook Page for Rep. Bill Thomas] * [http://house.legis.state.ak.us/rep.php?id=thm Alaska State Legislature Biography for Rep. Bill Thomas] * [http://votesmart.org/bio.php?can_id=27235 Project Vote Smart profile] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20121005001709/http://www.reelectthomas.com/ Bill Thomas 2012 Campaign Website] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20121006061912/http://www.reelectthomas.com/?feed=rss2 Bill Thomas 2012 Campaign RSS Feed] * [https://www.facebook.com/reelectbillthomas Bill Thomas 2012 Campaign Facebook Page] * [http://100years.akleg.gov/bio.php?id=860 Bill Thomas] at ''100 Years of Alaska's Legislature'' {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Thomas, Bill}} [[Category:1947 births]] [[Category:21st-century American politicians]] [[Category:Alaska Native people]] [[Category:Alaska Republicans]] [[Category:American fishers]] [[Category:American military personnel of the Vietnam War]] [[Category:Borough assembly members in Alaska]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Members of the Alaska House of Representatives]] [[Category:Native American state legislators]] [[Category:People from Haines Borough, Alaska]] [[Category:School board members in Alaska]] [[Category:Tlingit people]] [[Category:University of Alaska Fairbanks alumni]]

{{COI|date=February 2012}}
{{Infobox officeholder |name = Bishnu Pratap Shah |native name = |image = |imagesize = |caption =
|office1 = Secretary, Ministry of Information and Communication |term_start1 = |term_end1 = |predecessor1 = |successor1 =
|office2 = Chief Election Commissioner |appointer2 = |term_start2 = |term_end2 = |predecessor2 = |successor2 =
|birth_date = 29 August 1937 |death_date = 29 April 2005 |citizenship = Nepalese |nationality = {{flag|Nepal}} |occupation = [[public administration|Administrator]] |religion = [[File:Aum red.svg|20 px]] [[Hinduism]] |spouse = Ishwori Shah }}
[[File:Satyajit Ray, Bishnu Pratap Shaj and Lain Singh Bangde.jpg|thumb|right|alt= Gorkha Palace.| With legendary filmmaker [[Satyajit Ray]] and renowned scholar and painter [[Lain Singh Bangdel]]]]
'''Bishnu Pratap Shah''', a well known personality in the [[service sector]] of Nepal represented in his lifetime the cause of [[good governance]] in his own way. He served under different capacities and rose to the higher positions through his dedication to work, talent and capability. "Shah, who, had been appointed to important positions of Zonal Commissioner and Government Secretary during the party-less Panchayat era, also succeeded in getting high position of the Chief Election Commissioner<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tinepal.org/contents/activities/annual_report_8th_agm.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-02-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080819141443/http://www.tinepal.org/contents/activities/annual_report_8th_agm.html |archivedate=2008-08-19 |df= }}</ref> after the restoration of democracy in 1990 because of his personal integrity and dedication to work." " 1./ He had won the heart of the Nepalese readers through his thought provoking write-ups published in Kantipur daily from time to time. In one such article he had underlined the need to hold Constituent Assembly elections, long before the peace process was initiated as he had already smelt the root cause of the Maoist insurgency. In fact, he was not only an efficient administrator and honest civil servant, but also a person with diverse personality and high-vision.
Shah steered the Election Commission so perfectly that facilitated Nepal to hold Parliamentary as well as local level elections on the basis of the principle of adult-franchise to the satisfaction of all the political parties and the mission of the Peoples Movement I. Born in Maidi VDC Ward No. 2,<ref>http://ngm.nationalgeographic.com/print/features/world/asia/nepal/nepal-text</ref> Dhading district on 29 August 1937 to father Captain Lal Jung Shah and mother Subhadra Kumari. Shah was married to Ishwori Shah in 1971 B.S. and is survived by son Bimal Pratap Shah and daughter Binita Shah (Khadka)and grandchildren Sivashish Pratap Shah and Biraj Khadka. Shah died on 29 April 2005.
==Education and career==
[[File:BPS2.jpg|thumb|right|alt= At 50th Golder Jubilee Celebration, International Dimensions of Electoral Democracy, New Delhi, India.| At 50th Golder Jubilee Celebration, International Dimensions of Electoral Democracy, New Delhi, India]] Shah had received Master's Degree from [[Michigan State University]] in [[Anthropology]]. Shah started his career in civil service as the publicity officer of the then Election Commission in 1958 B.S. and served under different capacities including district Panchayat Secretary, Palpa, Chief District Officer of [[Gorkha]], [[Syangja]] and [[Sunsari]], Deputy Director General of [[Radio Nepal]], Joint Secretary in different government offices including the National Planning Commission, Zonal Commissioner of Bagmitati Zone and Secretary in the Ministry of Home Affairs and Ministry of Information and Communication, and the Prime Minister's Office. He also served as the first Chief Election Commissioner <ref>http://www.fesnepal.org/reports/2002/seminar_reports/nccs_social_disparity.htm</ref> of Nepal after the restoration of democracy in 1990. He had also served as board of director of different organizations including Radio Nepal and also served as the first chairperson of the French owned Indosuez Bank in Nepal.
==Representing Nepal== [[File:BPS1.jpg|thumb|right|alt= With HM Queen Elizabeth II.| With HM Queen [[Elizabeth II]], the constitutional monarch of 16 of the 54 sovereign states within the Commonwealth of Nations, and Head of the Commonwealth. ]] He had represented various government delegations to different countries including China, India, Cambodia, France and USA under different capacities. Shah paid visits to different countries including United States, Italy, France, [[Finland]], the [[Netherlands]], Germany, United Kingdom, [[Philippines]], [[Cambodia]], China, India, [[Hong Kong]], Switzerland, Spain, [[Thailand]], [[Pakistan]], [[Sri Lanka]], [[Egypt]] and [[Bangladesh]] under different occasions.
==Honors and accolades== Besides being honoured as the Chairman of Association of Asian Election Authorities (AAEA), he was also decorated with Trishakti Patta (Second) and [[Gorkha Dakshina Bahu]] (Second) at home and [[Legion of Honour]] (highest civilian honour of France). Shah had also served as chairman of board of directors of different schools, colleges and trusts. He had also authored various articles in Nepal and abroad on the topics of history, politics, administration, literature, tourism etc.
Shah was a patriotic person, dedicated civil servant and an efficient administrator. "With his quality to identify and solve problems, democratic attitude and thorough political analysis, many people will remember him for a long time" writes Prof. Ghanashyam Kandel. Senior journalist Yuvaraj Ghimire points out that "Shah did not only display honesty and spotless nature during his 45 year long career in public positions, he had also become non-controversial despite the change in political system and successfully conducted four elections including parliamentary and local level ones. He was liberal, cooperative and continued academic studies even after retirement from public service." "Shah always tried to forge consensus among the election commissioners while taking key decisions and he had never tried to impose his ideas on others" recalls Prof. Dr. BIrendra Prasad Mishra, who had worked as the Election Commissioner under the tenure of Shah. As a student Shah was talented, a mixable friend, qualified administrator, honest and loving parent of his family members. He had extraordinary wisdom, dedication and hardworking capacity and capacity to analyze things. We all may get inspiration from his life full of dedication, hard work, honesty and high intellectual capacity.
==Lineage== [[File:Bps6.jpg|thumb|right|alt= With Moshe Dayan Israel.| With [[Moshe Dayan]], The fourth Chief of Staff of the Israel Defense Forces (1953–58)]]
Bishnu Pratap Shah, according to the Shah dynastic linkage tree, directly represents the 16th generation of the then King Dravya Shah, the first king of Gorkha and Shah is descendant of [[Chandrarup Shah]] and [[Chautariya Pushkar Shah]]. [[Chandrarup Shah]] was the youngest son of King Prithwi-pati Shah [1] and Queen Kulangavati. He was appointed as Regent for his nephew Maharaj [[Nara Bhupal Shah]], while [[Chautariya Pushkar Shah]] was appointed to the post of Prime Minister in 1838.[13]
==References== {{Reflist}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Dan Johnstone | image = Can-Man-Dan-2016-2.jpg | alt = Don Johnstone holding a tomato can with the writing "Serving the community. Since 2011." | caption = Dan Johnstone (AKA Can Man Dan) poses for a picture in the midst of one of his signature winter campouts for [[Alberta]] [[food banks]]. | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1987|07|31}} | birth_place = [[Edmonton]], [[Alberta]], Canada | residence = Edmonton, Alberta, Canada | nationality = [[Canadians|Canadian]] [[Métis]] | occupation = [[Activist]], [[philanthropist]] | years_active = 2011 – present | website = {{url|http://www.danjohnstone.com}} }}
'''Dan Johnstone''' (born July 31, 1987 in [[Edmonton]], [[Alberta]]), also known as "'''Can Man Dan''',"<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/edmonton/can-man-dan-camps-out-for-edmonton-food-bank-1.2455883|title=Can Man Dan camps out for the Edmonton Food Bank|publisher=CBC|date=2013-12-08}}</ref> is a Canadian [[anti-poverty]] [[activist]], [[philanthropist]], [[community organizer]], and [[social activist]].<ref name="auto">{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonsun.com/2015/12/21/edmonton-anti-poverty-activist-can-man-dan-wraps-up-his-feed-alberta-tour-this-week|title=Local Anti-poverty activist "Can Man Dan" wraps up winter campout|publisher=Edmonton Sun|date=2015-12-21}}</ref><ref name="auto1">{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2015/12/02/can-man-dan-takes-show-on-the-road|title=Can Man Dan takes the show on the road|publisher=Edmonton Examiner|date=2015-12-02}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2013/05/08/20-questions-can-man-dan|title=20 Questions: Dan Johnstone a.k.a "Can Man Dan"|publisher=Edmonton Examiner|date=2013-05-13}}</ref><ref name="auto2">{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonsun.com/2015/07/07/who-should-be-edmontons-k-days-parade-marshal|title=Edmonton K-Days' parade marshals announced|publisher=Edmonton Sun|date=2015-07-08}}</ref><ref name="auto3">{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2015/09/09/can-man-dan-helps-families-with-the-small-things|title=Can Man Dan helps families|publisher=Edmonton Examiner|date=2015-09-09}}</ref> His fundraising group, also called "Can Man Dan," works to alleviate poverty and strengthen communities in [[Alberta]] by working with several [[non-profit]] groups and [[charities]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://globalnews.ca/news/322456/can-man-dan-launches-part-two-of-his-campaign-to-end-hunger-in-edmonton/|title=Can Man Dan launches part two of his campaign to end hunger in Edmonton|publisher=[[Global News]] |author=Caley Ramsey}}</ref> Johnstone hosts many events around Alberta, but is perhaps best known for his annual "Stand Against Hunger" campaign,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.channel12.ca/syn/110/78926/can-man-dan-is-at-it-again|title=Can Man Dan is at it again|publisher=Channel 12|date=2015-12-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2012/01/03/can-done-did|title=Can. Done. Did|publisher=Edmonton Examiner |author=Trevor Robb}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://globalnews.ca/news/2377953/can-man-dan-at-it-again-to-help-edmontons-less-fortunate/|title=Can Man Dan at it again to help Edmonton's less fortunate|publisher=Global News|date=2015-12-03}}</ref> where every December, Dan camps out for weeks in the back of a [[tractor-trailer]] aiming to fill it with food donations for various food banks & charities around Alberta.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2012/12/12/can-man-dan-camps-out-for-edmontons-food-bank|title=Can Man Dan camps out for Edmonton's Food Bank|publisher=Edmonton Examiner|date=2012-12-12}}</ref> Due to the severity of the winters commonly found in Alberta,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.metronews.ca/news/edmonton/2013/12/22/edmontons-can-man-dan-camps-out-before-christmas-for-the-food-bank.html|title=Can Man Dan camps out before Christmas for the Food Bank|publisher=Metro Edmonton|date=2013-12-22}}</ref> and the freezing cold temperatures that go along with them, these campouts have become highly publicized and staple events<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.660news.com/2014/12/12/can-man-dan-camps-out-for-the-food-bank/|title=Can Man Dan camps out for Calgary's Food Bank|publisher=660 News|date=2014-12-12}}</ref> for many food banks.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://ca.news.yahoo.com/man-dan-camp-raises-food-211220405.html|title=Can Man Dan camp out raises food and funds for Edmonton Food Bank|publisher=Yahoo News|date=2015-12-06}}</ref> Can Man Dan's "Stand Against Hunger" campaign has proven to be very successful, as Dan has raised hundreds of thousands of dollars, and hundreds of thousands of pounds of food for local food banks from these events alone.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/edmonton/can-man-dan-camp-out-nets-20-000-lbs-of-food-for-food-bank-1.2864418 |date=2014-12-08 |title=Can Man Dan campout nets 20000 pounds for food bank |deadurl=no |accessdate=2014-12-08 |work=CBC News}}</ref><ref name=can-man-return>{{cite news |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/edmonton/the-return-of-can-man-dan-1.1176871 |date=2012-12-07 |title=The return of Can Man Dan |deadurl=no |accessdate=2013-09-05 |work=CBC News}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.foodnonfiction.com/2015/12/38-can-man-dan.html|title=#38 Can Man Dan|publisher=Food non-fiction|date=2015-12-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Ftu7NQ_57Y|title=Can Man Dan hits southern Alberta|publisher=Shaw TV Lethbridge|date=2015-12-18}}</ref> Johnstone has created and hosted many other events around [[Alberta]] aimed to help those less fortunate, including his annual "We're Here For Ya Day" event.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://globalnews.ca/news/2920768/food-hampers-and-haircuts-can-man-dan-helps-hundreds-in-edmonton//|title=Food hampers and haircuts: Can Man Dan helps hundreds in Edmonton|publisher=[[Global News]] |author=Jennifer Ivanov}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://globalnews.ca/video/535536/can-man-dan|title=Can Man Dan|publisher=[[Global News]]}}</ref> Can Man Dan offers free hair services, a barbecue lunch, personal hygiene products, backpacks filled with school supplies, fresh bread, and food hampers to thousands of men, women and children every year on this day.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2013/05/08/cutting-out-hunger-fundraiser-featured-free-hair-cuts-hot-dogs-ice-cream-and-food-donations-to-the-food-bank|title=Cutting Out Hunger fundraiser featured free hair cuts, hot dogs, ice cream and food donations to the Food Bank|publisher=Edmonton Examiner|date=2013-05-08}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2014/09/03/in-its-second-year-can-man-dans-were-here-for-ya--event-in-edmonton-gives-away-food-haircuts-and-hair-products-takes-in-donations-for-food-bank|title=Can Man Dan is here for ya|publisher=Edmonton Examiner|date=2014-09-04}}</ref><ref name="auto3"/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2017/08/29/taking-stress-out-of-the-back-to-school-grind|title=Taking stress out of the back to school grind|publisher=Edmonton Examiner|date=2017-08-29}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/video?clipId=1198037|title=We're Here For Ya|publisher=CTV Edmonton|date=2017-11-21}}</ref>
After growing up in a [[single mother|single-mother]], [[low income|low-income]] household, Johnstone was motivated to support the same services that his family had used while he was growing up and started the Can Man Dan initiative.<ref name=can-man-return/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonsun.com/2014/12/16/can-man-dan-an-adopt-a-teen-success-story|title=Can Man Dan success story: Dan Johnstone a.k.a "Can Man Dan"|publisher=Edmonton Sun|date=2014-12-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.metronews.ca/news/edmonton/2012/12/07/can-man-dan-to-spend-weekend-in-truck-to-raise-food-funds-for-edmonton-food-bank.html|title=Can Man Dan to spend weekend in truck to raise food, funds for Food Bank|publisher=Metro Edmonton|date=2012-12-07}}</ref> Johnstone has stated that his ultimate goal is to raise awareness and support for charities in distress, and ultimately assist in the ending of [[poverty]] and [[homelessness]] in Alberta by forming a united community.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.danjohnstone.com/canmandan.htm|title=Dan Johnstone's official website|publisher=www.danjohnstone.com|date=2015-06-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2011/12/21/can-man-dan-is-moving-hunger-out|title=Can Man Dan is 'Moving Hunger Out'|publisher=Edmonton Examiner|date=2011-12-23}}</ref> On top of the various community events<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2012/12/18/dan-johnstone-aka-can-man-dan-hopes-to-meet-his-monetary-goal-for-edmontons-food-bank-this-weekend|title=Dan Johnstone, a.k.a Can Man Dan, hopes to meet his monetary goal for Edmonton's Food Bank this weekend|publisher=Edmonton Examiner|date=2012-12-18}}</ref> that he hosts, Johnstone is also a [[motivational speaker]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/Page11580.aspx|title=Giving back feels great|publisher=Alberta Health Services|date=2015-07-09}}</ref> that travels to many schools and high-profile events around western Canada to share his story and various adventures. Johnstone also leads an [[inner city]] feed program, where he and his group of volunteers make and distribute meals, care packages, and [[backpacks]] filled with different supplies to Edmonton's homeless community every month.<ref name="Edmonton Journal">{{cite news|url=http://edmontonjournal.com/news/local-news/students-deliver-care-packages-to-edmontons-less-fortunate|title=Students deliver care packages to Edmonton's less fortunate|publisher=Edmonton Journal|date=2017-05-11}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.metronews.ca/news/edmonton/2017/05/11/elementary-students-hand-out-care-packages-to-homeless-.html|title=Elementary students hand out care packages to homeless|publisher=Metro Edmontonl|date=2017-05-11}}</ref> Johnstone has stated, "I have never made a single cent off of this initiative, and I never will," <ref name="03 – DAN JOHNSTONE">{{cite news|url=https://thegtpodcast.com/2017/09/28/episode-03/|title=03 – DAN JOHNSTONE|publisher=The GT Podcast|date=2017-09-28}}</ref> as he believes that helping others and spreading a positive message throughout the community is more important than making a profit.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.danjohnstone.com/canmandan.htm|title=Dan Johnstone's official website|publisher=danjohnstone.com|date=2015-06-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sonic1029.com/2016/06/19/listen-legends-edmonton-ep/|title=Legends of Edmonton - Can Man Dan Johnstone|publisher=SONiC 102.9|date=2016-06-19}}</ref> Johnstone has also been an outspoken supporter for many other social issues and programs such as the protection of [[domestic abuse]] victims, supporting [[LGBTQ]] rights and freedoms, initiating a [[basic income]] for Canadians,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JMdS1mqFv3Q|title=Episode 3 Dan Johnstone|publisher=The GT Podcast|date=2017-09-28|time=63 minutes, 00 seconds}}</ref> and defending social housing projects.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.danjohnstone.com|title=Dan Johnstone's official website|publisher=Can Man Dan|date=2017-08-14}}</ref>
==Notable charitable work & career highlights== Johnstone's activism and philanthropy work began in Edmonton, Alberta in the [[summer]] of 2011, when he began going door-to-door around various neighbourhoods<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ammsa.com/publications/alberta-sweetgrass/edmonton-aboriginal-news-briefs-january-2015|title=Edmonton Aboriginal News|publisher=Aboriginal multi-media society|date=2015-07-28}}</ref> by himself collecting food and clothing donations for various charities, such as the Edmonton Food Bank, the youth shelter, and various homeless shelters and [[soup kitchens]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://alberta.ctvnews.ca/video?clipId=667190&binId=1.2002989&playlistPageNum=1|title=Can Man Dan on CTV Alberta Primetime|publisher=CTV Alberta Primetime|date=2015-07-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HTl1Aa70G7c|title=I like it RAW - Raw veganism in beef country|publisher=I like it RAW|date=2016-02-16|time=6 minutes, 04 seconds}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://naitnewswatch.ca/blogs/can-man-dans-plan/|title=Can Man Dan's Plan|publisher=NAIT News Watch|date=2015-01-22}}</ref> In June 2013, Can Man Dan provided immediate assistance to Calgary's Food Bank and those affected by the [[2013 Alberta floods]] in the form of 5000 pounds of food.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://globalnews.ca/video/675525/businesses-help |date=2012-12-18 |title=Businesses help |deadurl=no |accessdate=2013-09-05}}</ref> In both December 2013 and December 2014, local [[Edmonton]] chain restaurant, Delux Burger Bar, featured Can Man Dan as their "Celebrity Chef."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.btedmonton.ca/videos/3919368547001/|title=Can Man Dan at it again!|publisher=Edmonton Breakfast Television|date=2014-12-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wEa-i3ov_oU|title=Can Man Dan appears on City TV's BT|publisher=City TV|date=2014-12-02}}</ref> Delux Burger Bar locations across Edmonton added the Can Man Dan burger to their menus, and gave a portion of sales to the Edmonton Food Bank on Dan's behalf. Dan also arranged to have the Can Man Dan burger served to hundreds of Edmonton's homeless & less fortunate as he hosted "Burger Night" at one of Edmonton's local homeless shelters. Johnstone made headlines in April 2014 after he announced that he would wrestle in a [[professional wrestling]] match with Canadian wrestling promotion, the PWA (The [[Prairie Wrestling Alliance]]) to raise money, food and awareness for Edmonton's [[homeless youth]] population.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2014/04/23/edmontons-can-man-dan-will-wrestle-against-pros-to-help-raise-funds-for-yess|title=Can Man Dan fights for youth|publisher=Edmonton Examiner|date=2014-04-26}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ipick.ca/edmonton/edmontons-can-man-dan-will-wrestle-against-pros-to-help-raise-funds-for-yess|title=Edmonton's Can Man Dan will fight pro's to help raise money for YESS|publisher=iPick|date=2014-04-23}}</ref> Despite suffering a fractured nose during the bout, Johnstone ultimately won his debut [[wrestling]] match raising thousands of dollars and thousands of pounds of food for Edmonton's Youth Empowerment and Support Services (YESS), an organization that Dan's [[mother]] had used when she was a [[teenager]]. In the [[spring (season)|spring]] of 2015, Johnstone started a new community project aimed to help struggling locally-owned businesses attain new customers called "Localive".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/video?clipId=603677&binId=1.1203428&playlistPageNum=1|title=Localive|publisher=CTV Edmonton|date=2015-04-30}}</ref> In June 2015, "WO Magazine" listed Johnstone as one of their "Top 5 Anti-Poverty Activists".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.wo-magazine.com/politics/2015/6/8/top-five-anti-poverty-activists|title=Top 5 Anti-Poverty Activists|publisher=WO? Magazine|date=2015-06-10}}</ref>
In the [[summer]] of 2015, Johnstone was voted in by Edmonton's general public to serve as an honorary parade marshal for their annual [[K-Days]] festival parade. Johnstone, along with five other community heroes and various departments of Edmonton's [[first responders]], were made honorary parade marshals and each given $2500 to donate to a charity of their choice.<ref name="auto2"/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonjournal.com/Local+first+responders+will+lead+Days+parade+marshals/11198642/story.html|title=Local first responders will lead the way as K-Days parade marshals|publisher=Edmonton Journal|date=2015-07-08}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dinnertelevision.ca/videos/4344948231001/|title=K-Days' honorary parade marshals|publisher=Dinner TV|date=2015-07-08}}</ref> In November 2015, a press release was issued announcing that Johnstone was made honorary chairman and official ambassador for Edmonton's Adopt-A-Teen program, a social program that Dan and his family used when he was growing up. Since being made Adopt-A-Teen's honorary chairman in 2015, Johnstone has helped provide thousands of low-income and underprivileged teenagers with a $50 [[gift card]] for [[Christmas]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonsun.com/2015/12/08/can-man-dan-shares-how-50-edmonton-sun-adopt-a-teen-saved-christmas-for-family|title=Can Man Dan shares how Adopt-A-Teen saved Christmas|publisher=Edmonton Sun|date=2015-12-08}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.inews880.com/2015/12/15/adopt-a-teen-needs-your-help/|title=Adopt A Teen needs your help|publisher=iNews880|date=2015-12-15}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonsun.com/2015/12/25/thousands-of-edmonton-teens-have-reason-to-celebrate-on-christmas|title=Thousands of teens have a reason to celebrate|publisher=Edmonton Sun|date=2015-12-25}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonsun.com/2015/12/21/edmonton-anti-poverty-activist-can-man-dan-wraps-up-his-feed-alberta-tour-this-week|title=Can Man Dan wraps up his Feed Alberta Tour|publisher=Edmonton Sun|date=2015-12-21}}</ref> Johnstone made national headlines in December 2015 as he announced that he would spend the month touring Alberta and camping out in various cities to raise resources for multiple food banks across the province affected by the economic downturn.<ref name="auto"/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonsun.com/2015/12/02/edmonton--anti-poverty-activist-can-man-dan-touring-alberta-over-the-holidays-to-help-end-hunger|title=Can Man Dan touring Alberta to help end hunger|publisher=Edmonton Sun|date=2015-12-02}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://globalnews.ca/news/2408316/can-man-dan-stops-in-lethbridge-to-support-interfaith-food-bank/|title=Can Man Dan stops in Lethbridge|publisher=Global Lethbridge|date=2015-12-18}}</ref><ref name="auto1"/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.fortmcmurraytoday.com/2015/12/07/edmonton-man-brings-food-bank-fundraiser-to-fort-mcmurray|title=Can Man Dan comes to Fort McMurray|publisher=Fort McMurray Today|date=2015-12-07}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.630ched.com/2015/12/07/can-man-dan-takes-down-camp/|title=Can Man Dan takes down campout|publisher=630 CHED|date=2015-12-07}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://lethbridgelivingonline.com/news/general/item/can-man-dan-visits-lethbridge-to-benefit-interfaith-food-bank|title=Can Man Dan visits Lethbridge|publisher=Lethbridge Living Online|date=2015-12-01}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.country95.fm/news.asp?ID=10961|title=Can Man Dan to campout at Lethbridge Safeway|publisher=Country 95.5 fm|date=2015-12-14}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.country95.fm/blog.asp?ID=2355|title=Can Man Dan phone interview|publisher=Country 95.5 fm|date=2015-12-18}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://myinforms.com/en-ca/a/20041329-edmonton-anti-poverty-activist-can-man-dan-touring-alberta-over-the-holidays-to-help-end-hunger/|title=Edmonton Anti-Poverty activist touring Alberta over the holidays to help end hunger|publisher=MyInforms.com|author=Claire Theobald}}</ref> Johnstone's "Tour of Alberta" raised 25 [[tonnes]] of food and thousands of dollars for various food banks throughout Alberta to distribute to people in need.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://globalnews.ca/news/2386885/can-man-dan-helping-edmontons-food-bank-again/|title=Can Man Dan helping Edmonton's Food Bank Again|publisher=Global Edmonton|date=2015-12-07}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://lethbridgeherald.com/news/local-news/2015/12/24/can-man-dan-visit-spurs-local-donations/|title=Can Man Dan visit spurs donations for Food Bank|publisher=Lethbridge Herald|date=2015-12-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/edmonton/can-man-dan-camp-out-raises-food-money-for-edmonton-food-bank-1.3353177|title=Can Man Dan raises money for Food Bank|publisher=CBC News|date=2015-12-06}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.fortmacconnect.ca/2015/12/tis-the-season-to-support-the-food-bank/|title='Tis the season to support the Food Bank|publisher=Connect|date=2015-12-15}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.facebook.com/CanManDan|title=Can Man Dan announced Tour of Alberta results|publisher=Can Man Dan official Facebook Page|date=2015-12-25}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://lethbridgeherald.com/news/local-news/2015/12/20/the-can-man-can/|title=The Can Man Can|publisher=Lethbridge Herald|date=2015-12-20}}</ref> In May 2016, Johnstone revealed that he and his mother were former victims of [[domestic abuse]] and that he was starting a thirty-five-day campaign to raise awareness for domestic abuse victims and raise money for a local women's shelter (WIN House) in Edmonton. Johnstone's campaign consisted of completing six "extreme and wacky" [[stunts]] around [[Edmonton]], which were intended to raise awareness and money. Johnstone's stunts included wrestling in a [[professional wrestling]] match against [[Ring Of Honor]]'s [[Silas Young]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/site/2016/05/30/519-528-cwe-canada-tour-kazarian-lio-rush-silas-young-danny-duggan-action-plus-elite-8-tournament-multiple-title-matches/|title=CWE Canada Tour|publisher=PW Torch|date=2016-05-30}}</ref> becoming an [[Edmonton Eskimos]] [[cheerleader]] for a day, and undergoing intense [[police training]] with Edmonton Police Services, among other things.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.metronews.ca/news/edmonton/2016/05/16/can-man-dan-speaks-out-about-domestic-violence.html|title=Can Man Dan speaks out about domestic violence|publisher=Metro Edmonton|author=Alex Boyd|date=2016-05-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2016/05/18/local-anit-poverty-activist-to-perform-six-stunts-in-support-of-edmontons-womens-shelter|title=Can Man Dan has six new stunts up his sleeve to raise money for local women's shelter|publisher=Edmonton Examiner|date=2016-05-18}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.630ched.com/2016/05/23/can-man-dan-back-at-it-again-this-time-for-win-house/|title=Can Man Dan back at it again, this time for WIN House|publisher=630 CHED|date=2016-05-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cknw.com/syn/110/106280/can-man-dan-back-at-it-again-this-time-for-win-house|title=Can Man Dan is back at it|publisher=CKNW|date=2016-05-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sonic1029.com/2016/06/23/watch-edmonton-eskimo-cheerleader-day-can-man-dan/|title=Edmonton Eskimos Cheerleader for a day|publisher=SONiC 102.9|date=2016-06-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fQBLfiAU5Qo|title=Can Man Dan & WIN House stand up to domestic abuse|publisher=YouTube|date=2016-05-09}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://cwecanada.net/cwe-accepts-dan-can-man-dan-johnstones-open-challenge-for-edmontons-women-shelter/|title=CWE accepts Can Man Dan's open challenge|publisher=CWE Canada|date=2015-05-15}}</ref>
In December 2016, Johnstone embarked on his "Feed Alberta Tour" hoping to raise food and funds for various food banks across Alberta that were hit hard due to the ongoing [[recession]]. Johnstone travelled to the cities that were most affected by the stagnant economy and camped out in freezing cold temperatures for several days on end. Johnstone's "Feed Alberta Tour" raised more than 50 000 pounds of food and close to $20 000 in cash donations.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/can-man-dan-camps-out-to-collect-donations-for-edmonton-s-food-bank-1.3179291|title=Can Man Dan camps out to collect donations for Edmonton's Food Bank|publisher=CTV Edmonton|date=2016-11-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.630ched.com/2016/11/28/can-man-dan-raises-7k-and-7-5-tonnes-of-food-for-the-food-bank/|title=Can Man Dan raises 7k and 7.5 tonnes of food for the food bank|publisher=630 Ched|author=Mark Woolven|date=2016-11-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.lethbridgenewsnow.com/article/541378/can-man-dan-brave-elements-weekend|title=Can Man Dan to brave the elements this weekend|publisher=Lethbridge News Now|date=2016-12-15}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonsun.com/2016/12/17/adopt-a-teen-how-giving-grows|title=Adopt-A-Teen : How giving grows|publisher=Postmedia|author=Claire Theobald|date=2016-12-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://globalnews.ca/news/3086189/food-bank-fundraiser-can-man-dan-kicks-off-winter-campout-feed-alberta-tour/|title=Food bank fundraiser Can Man Dan kicks off winter campout "Feed Alberta Tour"|publisher=Global News|author=Karen Bartko|date=2016-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.metronews.ca/news/edmonton/2016/11/24/can-man-dan-kicks-off-2016-winter-tour-of-alberta.html|title=Can Man Dan kicks off 2016 winter tour of Alberta|publisher=Metro Edmonton|author=Ameya Charnalia|date=2016-11-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://globalnews.ca/news/3118238/edmonton-charities-worry-about-meeting-christmas-demand-in-bad-economy/|title=Edmonton charities worry about meeting Christmas demand in bad economy|publisher=Global News|author=Flether Kent|date=2016-12-12}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonsun.com/2016/12/11/my-2016-list-of-awesome-people|title=My 2016 list of awesome people|publisher=Edmonton Sun|author=Marty Forbes|date=2016-12-11}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://danjohnstone.com/2016/12/26/feed-alberta-tour-2016/|title=Feed Alberta Tour 2016|publisher=Dan Johnstone's official website|date=2016-12-26}}</ref> One month after its initial release in December 2016, Dan personally paid for forty low-income single parents and their children to watch ''[[Rogue One]]'' in theatres. Dan cited that [[Star Wars]] was one of his favorite movie franchises and he believed that all children should have the opportunity to watch it.<ref name="03 – DAN JOHNSTONE"/> In March 2017, Dan publicly urged Edmonton's [[city council]] to use a $38 million snow-removal surplus on renovating and restoring Edmonton's crumbling low-income housing units.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/edmonton/snow-removal-savings-help-city-slide-through-year-with-surplus-1.4008180|title=Snow-removal savings help city slide through year with surplus|date=2017-03-03}}</ref> In May 2017, Can Man Dan took 55 students from a local [[Catholic]] [[elementary school]] to down Edmonton's inner streets of to pass out hundreds of care packages filled with food, personal hygiene products, and socks to the cities' [[homeless]] and most vulnerable.<ref name="Edmonton Journal"/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.metronews.ca/news/edmonton/2017/05/11/elementary-students-hand-out-care-packages-to-homeless-.html|title=Elementary students hand out care packages to homeless|publisher=Metro Edmonton|date=2017-05-11}}</ref> In September 2017, Can Man Dan was voted "Best Activist" in [[Vue Weekly]]'s "Best of Edmonton 2017" series. Readers, along with Edmonton's general public voted Johnstone as Edmonton's "Best Activist" for his hard work and dedication to the community.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vueweekly.com/best-of-edmonton-2017-results/|title=Best of Edmonton 2017 results|publisher=Vue Weekly|date=2017-09-20}}</ref> In November 2017, Dan announced that he was hosting the "Can Man Dan city-wide food drive" to replenish Edmonton's struggling local food bank, which was seeing record high usage at the time.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://globalnews.ca/news/3877506/can-man-dan-collecting-food-for-the-edmonton-food-bank-before-the-holidays/|title=Can Man Dan collecting food for the Edmonton food bank before the holidays|publisher=Global News Edmonton|date=2017-11-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://edmontonsun.com/news/local-news/adopt-a-teen-can-man-dan-paying-kindness-forward|title=Adopt-A-Teen: Can Man Dan paying kindness forward|publisher=Edmonton Sun|author=Claire Theobald|date=2017-12-15}}</ref> Dan put out a plea to Edmonton residents and Edmonton's [[city council]] to help him "refill all of the empty shelves" at the Edmonton Food Bank and to work together to ensure that "no one goes hungry" over the holiday season.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/video?clipId=1267037|title=Can Man Dan|publisher=CTV Edmonton|date=2017-11-21}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2017/11/21/can-man-dan-collects-fundraises-for-food-bank|title=Can Man Dan collects, fundraises for food bank|publisher=Edmonton Examiner|author=Mitch Goldenberg|date=2017-11-22}}</ref> Dan's citywide food drive managed to raise over 110 000 pounds of food and $65 000 in 30 days.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://edmontonjournal.com/news/local-news/can-man-dan-collects-more-than-50000-kilograms-of-food-for-edmonton-food-bank|title=Can Man Dan collects more than 50 000 kilograms of food for Edmonton food bank|publisher=Edmonton Journal|author=Claire Theobald|date=2017-12-26}}</ref>
After the [[death of Colten Boushie]], Dan was just one of many aboriginal leaders to publicly condemn the not-guilty verdict.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://twitter.com/TheDanJohnstone/status/962165065045622784|title=Can Man Dan on Twitter: "I am aboriginal. I am 30 years old[...]|publisher=Twitter|date=2018-02-09}}</ref> In September 2018, Johnstone was able to equip 2 100 low-income children in the [[Edmonton]] region with school supplies, backpacks, food hampers, haircuts, and breakfast supplies before the 2018/2019 school semester started.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://globalnews.ca/video/4405206/were-here-for-you-day-supports-low-income-families-in-edmonton|title=We're Here For Ya Day supports low-income families in Edmonton and area.|publisher=Global News|date=2018-08-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://globalnews.ca/news/4424155/edmonton-families-free-school-supplies/|title=Edmonton families line up for free school supplies, haircuts as kids return to class|publisher=Global News|author=Albert Delitala|date=2018-09-02}}</ref> Later that month, Can Man Dan was also voted Edmonton's "Best Philanthropist" in [[Vue Weekly]]'s annual "Best of Edmonton" series, a local contest that is held ever year and where the winners are ultimately determined by [[online]] votes.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vueweekly.com/best-of-edmonton-2018/|title=Best of Edmonton 2018|publisher=Vue Weekly|date=2018-09-20}}</ref> In November 2018, Avenue Magazine awarded Dan with their prestigious "Top 40 Under 40" award for being a consummate changemaker and for his dedication to humanity.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.avenueedmonton.com/City-Life/Top-40-Under-40/2018/Dan-Johnstone/|title=Top 40 Under 40|publisher=Avenue Magazine|date=2018-11-01}}</ref>
==Personal life== Daniel Lee Johnstone was born in [[Edmonton]], [[Alberta]] on July 31, 1987 during the notorious [[Edmonton tornado]] (also known as "Black Friday") that claimed 27 lives, and he is the eldest son of Pamela Johnstone. Dan is an avid [[professional wrestling]] fan, a self-declared [[cinephile]], and [[board game]] enthusiast.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2013/05/08/20-questions-can-man-dan|title=20 Questions|publisher=Edmonton Examiner|date=2013-05-13}}</ref> His favourite [[television]] show is ''[[Game of Thrones]]'', and he is also a huge fan of [[reality television]], and has said that he one day hopes to compete on ''[[Big Brother Canada]]'' and ''[[The Amazing Race Canada]]''. Dan considers himself to be a political [[independent politician|independent]], but believes that all levels of government should take a more [[centrist]] approach when governing, as he believes that divisive and polarizing politics are harmful to a society and the community.<ref name="03 – DAN JOHNSTONE"/>
==Politics== In June 2013, Dan Johnstone announced that he would be running in the [[Edmonton municipal election, 2013]]. Johnstone declared that he would be running for the open seat in Edmonton's Ward 10 which was vacated by Mayoral hopeful, [[Don Iveson]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2013/06/26/dan-johnstone-aka-can-man-dan-seeks-vacant-ward-10-seat |last=Robb |first=Trevor |publisher=Edmonton Examiner |date=2013-06-26 |title=Dan Johnstone, a.k.a. Can Man Dan, seeks vacant Ward 10 seat |deadurl=no |accessdate=2013-09-05}}</ref> Johnstone, a self-declared [[fiscal conservative]], was the youngest candidate running for any position in the 2013 Edmonton election, being only 25 years old when he announced his candidacy. Johnstone's platform was largely based on the repair of basic [[infrastructure]], paying off the city's deficit, focusing on the revitalization of mature neighbourhoods, investing in the building of [[low income]] housing, as well as building a stronger [[public transit]] system while lowering fares.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thelocalgood.ca/election-2013-questionnaire-response-dan-johnstone-ward-10/|title=Election 2013 response: "Can Man Dan" Dan Johnstone|publisher=The Local Good|date=2013-08-25}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/2.2237/ward-ten/dan-johnstone-ward-ten-candidate|title=Dan Johnstone Ward 10 candidate|publisher=CTV Edmonton|date=2013-09-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.eliminatepovertyinedmonton.ca/election-2013/ward-10-dan-johnstone.html|title=Dan Johnstone - Ward 10|publisher=Eliminate Poverty Edmonton|date=2013-09-28}}</ref> Johnstone also pledged to self-fund his entire campaign and donate $10 000 for each year of his terms' salary to various charities and causes around Edmonton citing that, "politicians make entirely too much money."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.hersuccess.ca/running-political-office-dan-johnstone/|title=Running for political office with Dan Johnstone|publisher=Her Success|date=2016-06-18}}</ref> Johnstone openly refused to take money or campaign contributions from corporations, unions, developers, or special interest groups.<ref name="03 – DAN JOHNSTONE"/> He was ultimately defeated by former [[Alberta Party]] candidate, Michael Walters.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.edmonton.ca/city_government/municipal_elections/elections-2013-results.aspx |date=2013-10-21 |title=2013 Official Election Results |deadurl=no |accessdate=2013-10-21}}</ref>
On December 27 of 2015, Johnstone announced his candidacy for the Ward 12 [[by-election]] race in Edmonton's south-side district to replace [[Amarjeet Sohi]] who was elected to [[Justin Trudeau]]'s [[Liberal Party of Canada|Liberal]] government in October 2015.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonexaminer.com/2016/01/06/can-man-dan-runs-for-ward-12|title="Can Man Dan" runs for Ward 12|publisher=Edmonton Examiner|date=2016-01-06}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.metronews.ca/news/edmonton/2016/01/05/edmonton-ward-12-set-to-have-24-candidates-in-race-.html|title=Edmonton's Ward 12 set to have crowded field for byelection|publisher=Metro Edmonton|date=2016-01-04}}</ref> Johnstone, once again labelling himself as a [[fiscal conservative]] and socially progressive candidate, concentrated on restructuring Edmonton's photo radar system and redirecting a majority of the revenue to Edmonton's Police services, ushering in a more economical public transit system, postponing the building of the Valley Line LRT route, and mandating that a certain percentage of newly developed land must contain low-income and other forms of [[social housing]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.metronews.ca/news/edmonton/2016/02/09/edmonton-ward-12-candidates-weigh-in-on-the-valley-line-.html|title=Ward 12 candidates weigh in on the Valley Line LRT|publisher=Metro Edmonton|date=2016-02-08}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://edmontonjournal.com/news/politics/david-staples-edmonton-byelection-candidates-turning-against-lrt|title=Ward 12 candidates turning against Valley Line LRT|publisher=Edmonton Journal|date=2016-02-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vueweekly.com/ward-12-candidates-weigh-in-with-their-opinions-on-the-next-leg-of-the-lrt/|title=Ward 12 candidates weigh in with their opinions|publisher=Vue Weekly|date=2016-02-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://edmontonjournal.com/news/politics/david-staples-where-do-edmonton-ward-12-candidates-stand-on-key-issues|title=Where do Ward 12 candidates stand on key issues|publisher=Edmonton Journal|date=2016-02-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://edmontonjournal.com/news/local-news/who-are-edmontons-ward-12-candidates|title=Meet the 32 candidates of the Ward 12 by-election|publisher=Edmonton Journal|date=2016-01-26}}</ref> Johnstone was also openly critical of the record-breaking thirty-two candidates citing that it would confuse casual voters and result in a low voter turnout.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.edmontonsun.com/2016/01/24/edmontons-ward-12-byelection-log-jam-getting-worse|title=Ward 12 by-election log-jam getting worse|publisher=Edmonton Sun|date=2016-01-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=or580IB6C4k|title="Can Man Dan" Dan Johnstone talks by-election|publisher=Youtube|date=2016-01-25}}</ref> Johnstone was defeated by local police detective, Moe Banga.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/edmonton/moe-banga-wins-historic-ward-12-byelection-1.3459508|title=Moe Banga wins historic Ward 12 by-election|publisher=CBC|date=2016-02-22}}</ref>
In May 2018, Johnstone announced that he was seeking the [[Alberta Party]] nomination to be their official candidate in the upcoming 2019 Alberta provincial election. Johnstone was looking to represent the Alberta Party in the province's Edmonton-South district, but left near the end of June 2018, citing lack of "leadership, direction, and organization;" he also noted he was not impressed with the new leadership under [[Stephen Mandel]], and preferred the leadership style of former Alberta Party leader [[Greg Clark (Canadian politician)|Greg Clark]]. Although Johnstone's campaign was brief, he was running on a platform of lowering and controlling Alberta's ballooning debt (which is forecasted to hit $96 billion in 2023),<ref>{{cite news|url=http://edmontonjournal.com/news/politics/alberta-budget-2018-expected-to-reveal-road-map-to-balanced-books|title=Alberta budget 2018: NDP aims to erase deficit by 2023 as debt climbs to $96 billion|publisher=Edmonton Journal|date=2018-03-23}}</ref> supporting Alberta's small businesses and local entrepreneurs, investing in the building of more housing projects for low-income families and seniors, lowering taxes, protecting social programs that his family had used while living in poverty, and working to end the divisiveness often found in politics.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.thestar.com/edmonton/2018/05/14/anti-poverty-activist-can-man-dan-running-as-alberta-party-candidate-in-edmonton.html|title=Anti-poverty activist Can Man Dan running as Alberta Party candidate in Edmonton|publisher=Toronto Star|author=Catherine Griwkowsky|date=2018-05-14}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://danjohnstone.com/2018/05/14/let-me-be-your-champion-official-nomination-campaign-announcement/|title=Let me be your champion! Official Campaign Announcement & Resignation|publisher=Dan Johnstone's official website|author=Dan Johnstone|date=2018-06-27}}</ref>
==References== <references/>
==External links== *[http://www.danjohnstone.com Can Man Dan's official website] *[https://www.facebook.com/canmandan Official Can Man Dan Facebook fanpage] *[https://twitter.com/thedanjohnstone Can Man Dan on Twitter]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Can Man Dan}} [[Category:Anti-poverty advocates]] [[Category:Politicians from Edmonton]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alberta municipal politicians]] [[Category:1987 births]] [[Category:Canadian anti-poverty activists]] [[Category:Canadian philanthropists]] [[Category:Homelessness activists]] [[Category:Activists]]
