{{Infobox military person |name= Harold Keke |birth_date=1971 |death_date= |image= Harold Keke.jpg |caption= Harold Keke in a hut on the Solomon Islands, 2003 |nickname= |birth_place= |death_place= |allegiance= [[Guadalcanal Revolutionary Army]] |branch= [[Militia]] |serviceyears= |rank= General |unit= |commands= |battles= |awards= |relations= |laterwork= }} '''Harold Keke''' (born 1971) is a [[Solomon Islands]] [[warlord]] involved with the [[Guadalcanal Revolutionary Army]] (GRA).
== Biography == The grandson of one of the founders of the [[South Seas Evangelical Church]] in Australia,<ref name="trans">{{cite web| last = O'Shea| first = David| title = Harold Keke - Rebel or Raskol| publisher = ''[[Dateline (Australian TV program)|Dateline]]''| date = 2003-07-03| url = http://news.sbs.com.au/dateline/index.php?page=archive&daysum=2003-07-30| accessdate = 2007-07-07| deadurl = yes| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070611071727/http://news.sbs.com.au/dateline/index.php?page=archive&daysum=2003-07-30| archivedate = 2007-06-11| df = }}</ref> Keke was raised a Catholic in the Solomons,<ref>{{cite web| last = Skehan| first = Craig| title = Gun in one hand, Bible in the other| publisher = [[The Age]]| date = 2003-07-26| url = http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2003/07/25/1059084208417.html| accessdate = 2007-07-07}}</ref> but left the faith to become a petty criminal in [[Papua New Guinea]]. After a number of years, he returned home, where he took work as a police officer,<ref name="profile">{{cite web| title = Profile: Harold Keke| publisher = [[BBC News]]| date = 2005-03-18| url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/asia-pacific/3090297.stm| accessdate = 2007-07-07 }}</ref> and embraced [[evangelical Christianity]].<ref name="trans"/>
During the 1990s, tensions flared up between indigenous inhabitants of [[Guadalcanal]] and immigrants from neighboring [[Malaita]]. Following the election of [[Bartholomew Ulufa'alu]], militants, including those led by a newly radicalized Keke, began a campaign of intimidation and violence against Malaitan settlers. This, including Keke's 1998 raid of a police armory, led to the formation of the [[Malaita Eagle Force]] (MEF) and all out ethnic warfare in the islands.{{citation needed|date=August 2013}}
Keke views himself as a prophet, leading his people to their "promised land". He also claims that he had political backing for the start of the conflict from then-premier [[Ezekiel Alebua]] — who provided money, weapons, and ammunition for the GRA. This claim has been denied by Alebua, who calls Keke "little more than a violent thug".<ref name="trans"/>
During the ensuing conflict, the MEF gained the upper hand, deposing the government and gaining control of most police forces; making them a ''de facto'' extension of the militias. Many of the militias opposed to the MEF struck a peace deal in late 2000, but Keke refused to sign, moving his soldiers into the jungles of the Weather Coast to avoid capture.<ref name="trans"/>
The GRA, under Keke's leadership, has been accused of a variety of crimes, including arson, kidnapping, assassination, and murder. Keke has been personally implicated in more than 50 murders,<ref>{{cite web| title = Solomons warlord Keke in custody of Australians| publisher = [[Associated Press]]| date = 2003-08-14| url = http://www.taipeitimes.com/News/world/archives/2003/08/14/2003063687| accessdate = 2007-07-07}}</ref> including that of cabinet minister and priest [[Augustine Geve]],<ref>{{cite web| title = Cabinet minister shot dead| publisher = [[One News (New Zealand)|ONE News]]| date = 2002-08-24| url = http://tvnz.co.nz/view/news_world_story_skin/126475| accessdate = 2007-07-07 }}</ref> as well as seven [[missionaries]] from the [[Melanesian Brotherhood]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.anglicancommunion.org/acns/news.cfm/2003/11/7/ACNS3667 |title=Funeral of the seven martyred Melanesian Brothers |date=2003-11-07 |publisher=Anglican Communion News Service |accessdate=2008-05-11 }}</ref>
In late 2003, following the arrival of a multi-national intervention force led by [[Australia]], Keke called for a cease-fire, and surrendered to peace-keepers.<ref name="bbc">{{cite web| title = Solomons warlord surrenders| publisher = [[BBC News]]| date = 2003-08-13| url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/asia-pacific/3146413.stm | accessdate = 2007-07-07 }}</ref> In 2005, he was convicted of the murder of Geve, and sentenced to [[life sentence|life in prison]].
==See also== *[[History of the Solomon Islands#Civil war|History of the Solomon Islands]] *[[Regional Assistance Mission to Solomon Islands]] *[[Politics of Solomon Islands]]
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Keke, Harold}} [[Category:1971 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Solomon Islands evangelicals]] [[Category:Former Roman Catholics]] [[Category:Solomon Islands prisoners sentenced to life imprisonment]] [[Category:Prisoners sentenced to life imprisonment by the Solomon Islands]] [[Category:Solomon Islands people convicted of murder]] [[Category:People convicted of murder by the Solomon Islands]] [[Category:People from Guadalcanal Province]] [[Category:Warlords]]

{{more citations needed|date=May 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} [[File:Makibi Enomiya-Lasalle (1898-1990).jpg|thumb|right|upright=1.16|Father Hugo Enomiya-Lassalle]] {{Zen Buddhism}} {{Western Buddhism}} '''Hugo Makibi Enomiya-Lassalle''' (11 November 1898<ref name="newday">{{cite book|last=Akinade|first=Akintunde E.|title=A New Day: Essays on World Christianity in Honor of Lamin Sanneh|publisher=Peter Lang|year=2010|page=242|ISBN=9781433104565}}</ref> in Gut Externbrock near [[Nieheim]], [[Province of Westphalia|Westphalia]] – 7 July 1990<ref name="newday"/> in [[Münster]], [[North Rhine-Westphalia|Westphalia]]) was a German [[Society of Jesus|Jesuit]] priest and one of the foremost teachers to embrace both Roman Catholic [[Christianity]] and [[Zen]] [[Buddhism]].<ref name="newday"/>
==Biography==
Enomiya-Lassalle joined the [[Society of Jesus]] on 25 April 1919. At the end of the usual Jesuit spiritual and academic training he was ordained [[Catholic priest|priest]] on 28 August 1927.
He travelled to Japan as a [[Catholic missionary|missionary]] in 1929 and became interested in that country's [[Buddhism|Buddhist]] practices. In 1940, he became the vicar of [[Hiroshima]], and on 6 August 1945 he was critically wounded by the nuclear blast in that city, which is depicted in [[John Hersey]]'s book ''[[hiroshima (book)|Hiroshima]]''.<ref>[[John Hersey]]: ''Hiroshima''; [[Vintage Books]], New York 1989, p 11 etc</ref> Shortly thereafter, he returned to Germany.
In September 1946, he had an audience with [[Pope]] [[Pius XII]], in which he revealed his plan to build in Hiroshima a [[cathedral]] dedicated to the idea of world peace. Designed by Japanese architect [[Togo Murano]], construction on the cathedral began in 1950 and on 6 August 1954, the [[Assumption of Mary Cathedral, Hiroshima|Memorial Cathedral for World Peace]]（[[:ja:世界平和記念聖堂|ja]]）was dedicated.<ref>http://cpap.hiroshima-diocese.net/?page_id=3543</ref>
In 1956, Enomiya-Lassalle began studying Zen with [[Harada Daiun Sogaku]].<ref name="newday"/><ref name="journeys">{{cite book|last=Oldmeadow|first=Harry|title=Journeys East: 20th Century Western Encounters with Eastern Religious Traditions|publisher=World Wisdom, Inc|year=2004|pages=429–430|ISBN=9780941532570}}</ref> In 1958, he published ''Zen: A Way to Enlightenment''.<ref name="journeys"/>
Following Harada's death in 1961, Enomiya-Lassalle became an apprentice of one of Harada's students, [[Yamada Koun]]. Yamada was enthusiastic about the possibilities of Zen as a Christian practice, believing that "''Zen would become an important stream in the Catholic Church one day''".<ref>[http://terebess.hu/english/sharf.html Terebess Asia Online]</ref> With Enomiya-Lassalle's active assistance, he attracted a number of Catholic priests and nuns as students. In the late 1960s, Enomiya-Lasalle was certified as a teacher in Yamada's [[Sanbo Kyodan]] sect and given the title ''[[Rōshi|roshi]]'' ([[Zen master]]), while professing his continued belief in Christianity. After 1968, Enomiya-Lassalle spent much of his time in Europe leading Zen retreats and encouraging Zen practice among Christians. His books influenced symphony conductor [[Herbert von Karajan]] to study Zen and incorporate a Zen mindset into his conducting.
[[File:Hiroshima World Peace Memorial Cathedral.jpg|thumb|none|upright=0.9|Memorial Cathedral for World Peace, at Naka-ku Hiroshima Japan, design by Togo Murano in 1954]]
==Bibliography== *''Zen: Way to Enlightenment'' (1964) *''Zen Meditation for Christians'' (1974) *''Living the New Consciousness'' (1984) *''The Practice of Zen Meditation'', (1987, [[HarperCollins|Thorsons]]).
==See also== *[[Heinrich Dumoulin]] *[[Hubert Schiffer]]
==References== {{reflist}}
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Enomiya-Lassalle, Hugo}} [[Category:1898 births]] [[Category:1990 deaths]] [[Category:People from Höxter (district)]] [[Category:People from the Province of Westphalia]] [[Category:German Jesuits]] [[Category:Japanese Jesuits]] [[Category:German Zen Buddhists]] [[Category:Buddhism and Christianity]] [[Category:Naturalized citizens of Japan]] [[Category:People associated with the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki]] [[Category:Hibakusha]]

This is a list of '''notable people from Bruges''', who were either born in [[Bruges]], or spent part of their life there.
==People born in Bruges== [[Image:Juan de Flandes 004.jpg|thumb|[[Philip I of Castile]], Duke of Burgundy]] [[Image:Simon-stevin.jpeg|thumb|[[Simon Stevin]], mathematician and engineer]]
===Before the 19th century=== *[[Jan Breydel]], leader of the uprising against the French (13th century) *[[Pieter de Coninck]], weaver and leader of the uprising against the French (13th century) *[[Joannes Corvus]], portrait painter *[[Jan Heem]], craftsman and politician (13th century) *[[Anselm Adornes]], merchant, diplomat (8 December 1424 - 1483) *[[Louis de Gruuthuse]], Flemish knight, courtier, and nobleman (1427–1492) *[[Philip I of Castile]], first [[Habsburg]] ruler in [[Spain]] (1478–1506) *[[Adriaen Isenbrant]], [[Renaissance]] painter (1490–1551) *[[Adrian Willaert]], composer of the [[Renaissance]] (c. 1490–1562, birth in Bruges uncertain) *[[Petrus Vulcanius]], humanist scholar and administrator (c 1503-1571) *[[Bonaventura Vulcanius]], humanist scholar (1538-1614) *[[Levina Teerlinc]], Flemish miniaturist (1510–1576) *[[Johannes Vasaeus]], humanist, teacher, historian (1511-1561) *[[Marcus Gheeraerts the Elder]], engraver, illustrator, and painter (c. 1520 – c. 1590) *[[Marcus Gheeraerts the Younger]], painter (1561–1636) *[[Stradanus]], mannerist painter (1523–1605) *[[Pamelius]], theologian (1536–1587) *[[Peter Candid]], painter and architect (1548–1628, birth in Bruges uncertain) *[[Simon Stevin]], mathematician and engineer (1548–1620) *[[Franciscus Gomarus]], [[Calvinist]] theologian (1563–1641) *[[Louis de Deyster]], Flemish painter (1656–1711)
===19th century=== *[[Henri Milne-Edwards]], French zoologist (1800–1885) *[[Eugène Charles Catalan]], mathematician (1814–1894) *[[Paul Jean Clays]], marine painter (1819–1900) *[[Émile Louis Victor de Laveleye]], economist (1822–1892) *[[Guido Gezelle]], poet and priest (1830–1899) *[[Eugène Goossens, père]], conductor (1845–1906) *[[Albin van Hoonacker]], Catholic theologian and Biblical scholar (1857–1933) *[[Frank Brangwyn]], Welsh artist, painter, colourist, engraver, and illustrator (1867–1956) *[[Tim Verfaillie]], expressionist painter (1893–1934)
===20th century=== *[[Nelly Landry]], French tennis player (born 1916–2010) *[[Hugo Claus]], novelist, poet, playwright, painter, and film director (born 1929–2008) *[[Jean Schramme]], colonel and mercenary in [[Katanga Province|Katanga]] (1929–1988) *[[Andries Van den Abeele]], historian, historical preservationist, entrepreneur and politician (councilor and alderman of Bruges) (born 1935) *[[Noël Devisch]], agriculture (born 1943) *[[Jean-Pierre Van Rossem]], politician, entrepreneur, and writer (born 1945) *[[Alain Billiet]], alleged designer of the [[euro sign]] (born 1951) *[[Pierre Chevalier (Belgian politician)|Pierre Chevalier]], politician (born 1952) *[[Pieter Aspe]], writer of detective stories (born 1953) *[[Kris Defoort]], avant-garde jazz pianist and composer (born 1959) *[[Frank Vanhecke]], politician (born 1959) *[[Geert Hoste]], cabaret performer (born 1960) *[[Filip Dewinter]], politician (born 1962) *[[Peter Verhelst]], novelist, poet, and dramatist (born 1962) *[[Geoffrey Claeys]], football player (born 1974) *[[Olivier De Cock]], football player (born 1975) *[[Denis Viane]], football player (born 1977) *[[Gotye]], Australian-Belgian singer songwriter (born 1980) *[[Tony Parker]], basketball player (born 1982)
==Lived in Bruges== [[Image:Van Eyck - Arnolfini Portrait.jpg|thumb|The ''[[Arnolfini portrait]]'' by [[Jan van Eyck]]]]
===15th century=== *[[Philip III, Duke of Burgundy|Philip the Good]], Duke of Burgundy *[[Giovanni Arnolfini]], Italian merchant *[[Adrien Basin]], [[Franco-Flemish School|Franco-Flemish]] composer, singer, and diplomat *[[William Caxton]], English merchant, diplomat, write, and printer *[[Petrus Christus]], Flemish painter *[[Gerard David]], [[Renaissance]] painter *[[Lupus Hellinck]], composer of the [[Renaissance]] *[[Gilles Joye]], [[Franco-Flemish School|Franco-Flemish]] composer of the [[Renaissance]] *[[Roger Machado (officer of arms)|Roger Machado]], diplomat and officer of arms *[[Hans Memling]], Flemish painter *[[Tommaso Portinari]], Italian banker for the [[Medici bank]] *[[Jan Provoost]], Flemish painter *[[Jean Richafort]], [[Franco-Flemish School|Franco-Flemish]] composer of the [[Renaissance]] *[[Jan van Eyck]], Flemish painter *[[Juan Luís Vives]], Spanish scholar and humanist
[[Image:Neige-Bruges-1910.JPG|thumb|200px|right|Georges Emile Lebacq, 1910 '' Snow at Bruges'']]
===16th century until now=== *[[George Cassander]], Flemish theologian (1513–1566) *[[Pieter Pourbus]], Flemish [[Renaissance]] painter (1523–1584) *[[Bernard Jungmann]], German theologian and ecclesiastical historian (1833–1895) *[[Fernand Khnopff]], [[symbolist]] painter (1858–1921) *[[Georges Emile Lebacq]], Belgian artist, painter, colourist, pastellist, [[Impressionist]], Post-Impressionist (1876–1950) *[[Karel Verleye]] and [[Hendrik Brugmans]], founders of the [[College of Europe]] *[[Godfried Danneels]], archbishop and cardinal (born 1933) *[[Pieter Aspe]], writer *[[Salah Abdeslam]] Terrorist accused of involvement in the November 2015 Paris Attacks, and the March 2016 Brussels Attacks. (Born September 15th 1989)
[[Category:People by city in Belgium|Bruges]] [[Category:People from Bruges|*]] [[Category:Lists of Belgian people|Bruges]] [[Category:Lists of people by place]]

revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=January 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Madeleine ffrench-Mullen | image = File:Madeleine ffrench Mullen.JPG | alt = | caption = | birth_date = 30 December 1880 | birth_place = Malta | death_date = 26 May 1944 | death_place = Dublin, Ireland | nationality = Irish | occupation = Irish revolutionary and labour activist}}
'''Madeleine ffrench-Mullen''' (30 December 1880 – 26 May 1944) was an Irish revolutionary and labour activist who took part in the [[Easter Rising]] in Dublin in 1916.
ffrench-Mullen was a member of the radical nationalist women's organisation {{lang|ga|[[Inghinidhe na hÉireann]]}}. In 1913 during the [[Dublin Lock-out]], she worked in the soup kitchen in [[Liberty Hall]]. She subsequently joined the [[Irish Citizen Army]] (ICA).<ref name=Bryan>Deirdre Bryan, "Mullen, Madeleine ffrench-", ''Dictionary of Irish Biography''.<!--publisher; year of publication; ISSN/ISBN needed--></ref> In the Easter Rising she worked in a first aid tent. She was arrested following the Rising but released the following month.<ref name=Bryan /> She joined [[Sinn Féin]] and was elected to Rathmines District Council in 1920.<ref name=Bryan />
== Early life == Madeleine ffrench-Mullen was born on 30 December 1880 in Malta, where her father, St Lawrence ffrench-Mullen, a Royal Navy surgeon, was stationed. She had two brothers, St Lawrence Patrick Joseph (1890–1891) and Douglas (1893–1943).<ref name=Bryan /><ref name=Luddy>{{cite web|last1=Luddy|first1=Maria|title=Madeleine ffrench mullen|url=http://www.oxforddnb.com/view/article/58635|website=Oxford Dictionary of National Biography|publisher=Oxford University Press|accessdate=29 October 2015|ref=Luddy}}</ref>
== Women Rights and the Suffrage Movement == ffrench-Mullen's interest in politics started young, Her father was a committed Parnellite and their Dundrum home was a campaign headquarters. She was a radical feminist and republican during her life. Like many other of the time she regarded it as a woman's right to vote. She joined the [[Women's suffrage|suffrage]] movement, and met women with a similar worldview and values. The women's suffrage movement was included in the Movements of Extremists reports of the [[Dublin Metropolitan Police]].<ref name="DMP reports">{{cite web|title=Chief Secretary's Office, Crime Branch: Dublin Metropolitan Police (DMP) Movement of Extremists 29 May 1915 – 20 April 1916|url=http://www.nationalarchives.ie/digital-resources/chief-secretarys-office-crime-branch-dublin-metropolitan-police-dmp-movement-of-extremists-29-may-1915-20-april-1916/dmp-reports-june-1915/|website=National Archives of Ireland|accessdate=20 November 2015|pages=7, 14 June, 4 October 1915}}</ref> ffrench-Mullen went on to join [[Inghinidhe na hÉireann]], a radical nationalist women's group founded by [[Maud Gonne]] in 1900. The organisation developed into [[Cumann na mBan]] in 1913. Suffragist values were central to [[Cumann na mBan]]'s goal of standing side-by-side with men in the fight for the Irish Republic. Some members saw this as women regaining the rights that had belonged to them in pre-invasion Gaelic civilisation.<ref>{{Cite book|title = Guerrilla Warfare in the Irish War of Independence, 1919–1921|url = https://books.google.com/books?id=BxLb0aZOFOMC|publisher = McFarland|date = 17 February 2011|isbn = 978-0-7864-8519-2|first = Joseph|last = McKenna}}</ref> ffrench-Mullen was on the socialist wing of the moment, holding to the ideals of universal social equality of the syndicalist [[James Connolly]] and the [[Irish Citizen Army]].
== The 1916 Rising == During the [[Easter Rising]] of 1916, ffrench-Mullen served as a lieutenant in the [[Irish Citizen Army]]. She saw action with the [[St Stephen's Green]] and [[Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland|Royal College of Surgeons]] garrison.<ref name=Bryan /><ref name=Luddy /><ref name=DFS /> In St Stephen's Green she was in command of the 15 Citizen Army women who set up a medical station and field kitchen.<ref name=DFS>{{cite book|last1=Ferriter|first1=introduction by Diarmaid|title=Dublin's fighting story, 1916–21 : told by the men who made it; with a unique pictorial record of the period|date=2009|publisher=Mercier Press|location=Cork|isbn=978-1-85635-643-5|ref=DFS}}</ref><ref name=Gillis /> While occupying St Stephen's Green, she and her comrades came under sustained heavy fire from the [[Shelbourne Hotel|Shellbourne Hotel]]<ref name=DFS /> and buildings on the north side of the Green.<ref name=MffM>{{cite book|last1=ffrench Mullen|first1=Madeleine|title=Transcript of Madeleine ffrench-Mullen diary written in Kilmainham and Mountjoy Jails, 5–20 May 1916.|date=May 1916|publisher=The Allen Archival Collection. The Allen Library|location=Dublin|url=http://slinabande.ie/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/DiaryMFM1916.pdf|accessdate=5 September 2018|ref=MffM}}</ref> After the surrender of the College of Surgeons garrison ffrench-Mullen was one of the 77 women who had fought in the Rising who were imprisoned, among them her close friend [[Kathleen Lynn|Dr Kathleen Lynn]]. While in captivity ffrench Mullen was moved three times, spending time in [[Richmond Barracks]], [[Kilmainham Gaol]] and [[Mountjoy Jail]]. She was released on 5 June 1916.<ref>Mountjoy Prison record, National Archives of Ireland</ref>
== ffrench-Mullen and Kathleen Lynn == ffrench-Mullen met Kathleen Lynn through Inghinidhe na h-Éireann.<ref name=Gillis>{{cite book|last1=Gillis|first1=Liz|title=Women of the Irish Revolution|date=2014|publisher=Mercier Press|isbn=978-1-78117-205-6|page=39|ref=Gillis}}</ref><ref name=BMH>{{cite web|title=Witness statement of Dr Kathleen Lynn|url=http://www.bureauofmilitaryhistory.ie/reels/bmh/BMH.WS0357.pdf|website=bureauofmilitaryhistory.ie|publisher=Irish military and national archives|accessdate=28 October 2015|ref=BMH}}</ref> She moved into Lynn's [[Rathmines|Belgrave Road, Rathmines]] home in 1915,<ref name=Luddy /> and they shared a life until ffrench-Mullen's death in 1944,<ref name=BMH /> living together in Rathmines for 30 years.
ffrench-Mullen recorded in her prison diary in 1916 that she could face prison without fear once Lynn (whom she referred to as "the Doctor") and she were together.<ref name=MffM /> Katherine Lynch of the Women's Studies Centre at [[University College Dublin]] describes them as partners, calling them part of a network of lesbians living in Dublin—which included [[Helena Molony]], [[Louie Bennett]] and [[Elizabeth O'Farrell]]—who met through the suffrage movement and later became involved with the national and trade union movement.<ref>{{cite book|last1=O'Donnell|first1=Katherine|editor1-last=Lalor|editor1-first=Brian|title=The Encyclopaedia of Ireland|date=2003|publisher=Gill and Macmillan|page=624|url=http://researchrepository.ucd.ie/bitstream/handle/10197/2894/Irish%20Lesbian%20History%20encyclopedia.pdf?sequence=1|accessdate=24 November 2015|chapter=Lesbianism}}</ref> [[File:Belgrave Road residence of Kathleen Lynn and Madeleine ffrench Mullen.JPG|thumb|The house shared by Kathleen Lynn and Madeleine ffrench Mullen.]]
== Legacy: St Ultan's == Madeleine ffrench-Mullen and Kathleen Lynn established [[Saint Ultan's Children's Hospital]],<ref name="H Smith">{{cite journal|last1=Smith|first1=Hazel. P|title=Kathleen Lynn, M.D., F.R.C.S.I. (1874–1955)|journal=Dublin Historical Record|year= 1977|issue=2|page=54|jstor=30087174|registration=yes|ref=H Smith}}</ref> also known as ''Teach Ultan'', was a female-run hospital for infants at 37 Charlemont Street, Dublin in 1919.<ref>ST. ULTAN'S HOUSE. (24 May 1919). The Irish Times (1874–1920) Retrieved from http://search.proquest.com/docview/516996400</ref> The hospital focused on children's health and wellbeing, an area that was perceived at the time as women's concern. In the aftermath of [[World War I|WW1]] many health problems had arisen including a rise in venereal diseases such as [[syphilis]], carried from soldiers returning home from war.<ref>{{Cite journal|title = Syphilis and the state|last = Kirkpatrick|first = Thomas Percy C.|date = June 1918|journal = The Dublin journal of medical science|volume = CXLV|pages = 339–357}}</ref> Many of Ireland's infants of the time suffered from [[congenital syphilis]] (inherited disease from mother at birth) this was a driving factor in the opening of St Ultan's hospital.<ref>{{Cite book|title = Renegades: Irish Republican Women 1900–1922|url = https://books.google.com/books?id=pzYkTYi3JRgC|publisher = Mercier Press Ltd|date = 1 January 2010|isbn = 978-1-85635-684-8|first = Ann|last = Matthews|page = 213}}</ref> [[Tuberculosis]] was endemic in Ireland during its time as a British colony. Against steadfast opposition by the State and the Catholic Church, Lynn and ffrench Mullen established a vaccination project, vaccinating thousands of impoverished children who would certainly have succumbed to TB without their vaccines. Their success led to the foundation of Ireland's [[BCG vaccine|BCG]] programme, which has vaccinated all babies since the 1950s.
== Death == Madeleine ffrench-Mullen died in a Dublin nursing home on 26 May 1944, aged 63.<ref name=Bryan /> She is interred with her parents, St Lawrence (1846–1895) and Margaret (1857–1912), as well as her younger brothers (whom she outlived), St Lawrence Patrick Joseph (1890–1891) and Douglas (1893–1943), in the ffrench-Mullen family plot in [[Glasnevin Cemetery]].<ref name=Graves>{{cite web<!--|title=Find a Grave-->|url=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49544888|website=''Findagrave.com''|title=ffrench-Mullen family|accessdate=23 October 2015}}</ref> Her funeral took place on the same day as the [[Irish general election, 1944|1944 General Election]].<ref name=Bryan /> Lynn died in 1955 and is interred in [[Deans Grange Cemetery]].<ref name=Bryan /><ref name=grave>{{cite web|title=Kathleen Florence Lynn profile|url=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/31644911|website=findagrave|accessdate=2 November 2015}}{{Primary source inline|date=January 2018}}</ref>
== References == {{Reflist}}
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Ffrench-Mullen, Madeleine}} [[Category:1880 births]] [[Category:1944 deaths]] [[Category:Early Sinn Féin politicians]] [[Category:Easter Rising]] [[Category:Irish revolutionaries]] [[Category:People of the Easter Rising]] [[Category:Women in war in Ireland]]

revision.comment: re-categorisation per [[WP:CFDS|CFDS]], replaced: Category:NASA personnel → Category:NASA people using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{Unreferenced|date=February 2007}} The [[Magellan probe|Magellan]] project was set up so that the initial images and data from the Magellan probe were only for use and study by a team of [[Magellan Principal Investigators|principal investigators]] from a variety of universities and institutions, and by the [[Magellan Project Science Team]]. These scientists were responsible for validating the data, contributing input for spacecraft acquisition of data, and interpreting the data results for their release to the public. Data were shared with three visiting Soviet scientists ([[Alexander Basilevsky]], Effaim Akim and Alexander Zacharov), a first, and sensitive issue, for NASA at the time considering the [[Cold War]] was just coming to a close.
The Magellan Project Science room became notorious for its hanging of long thermal print strips of image data (FBIDRs) along the walls of a spacious room. This was the first form in which the imagery of the surface of Venus was seen due to the long, narrow swathes acquired by the spacecraft. Significant guests during the mission's operation included [[Margaret Thatcher]].
After the initial investigation stage Magellan's full data set was released for public consumption.
[[Category:NASA people|*]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Pan Sutong
潘蘇通 | image = PanSutong--GFDL----Attribution--.jpg | nationality = [[Hong Kong people|Hong Kong]] | birth_date = 1963 | birth_place = [[Guangdong]], China | residence = [[Hong Kong]] | net worth = US$5.6 billion (May 2018)https://www.forbes.com/billionaires/list/#version:realtime_search:pan%20sutong | occupation = Founder of Matsunichi Digital Holdings Limited
Chairman of Goldin Group
Chairman of Goldin Properties Holdings Limited
Chairman of Goldin Financial Holdings Limited
Vice President of the Federation of International Polo (FIP)
Chairman of the Hong Kong Polo Development and Promotion Federation (HKPDPF) | website = [http://www.goldingroup.com/en/index.php Official Website of Goldin Group] }} '''Pan Sutong''' is a [[Hong Kong]] businessman and entrepreneur. He is the Founder of Matsunichi Digital Holdings Limited, presently also the Chairman of Goldin Real Estate Financial Holdings Limited (also known as Goldin Group). ==Biography== Pan Sutong was born in Shaoguan, Guangdong, China in 1963. He emigrated to the USA in 1976, and then moved to Hong Kong in 1984 and started trading with electronics brands like Panasonic. In 1993, he founded Matsunichi Colour Display Monitor Company Limited, the main business of which is the manufacturing of home appliances.[http://globaldocuments.morningstar.com/documentlibrary/document/06a37a4898400149.msdoc/original Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements] In 2002, he bought Hong Kong listed company Emperor Technology Venture Limited and had it renamed as Matsunichi Communication Holdings Limited. On 3 September 2008, this company was further renamed as Goldin Properties Holdings Limited.Conditional cash offer for all shares in Emperor Technology Venture Limited by Somerley Limited on behalf of Jade Forest Limited [http://www.sfc.hk/web/EN/pdf/past-dealing-disclosures/en/02sda55.html.pdf] In late 2008, Pan Sutong bought another Hong Kong listed company, Fortuna International Holdings Limited, and had it renamed as Goldin Financial Holdings Limited.Further Announcement In Relation To The Very Substantial Acquisition And Proposed Change Of Company Name [http://www.goldinfinancial.com/wcms-common/temp/eng/pdf/announcement/2009/17-03-2009.pdf] Pan Sutong privatized Goldin Properties Holdings Limited through a cash offer with the compulsory acquisition of all shares completed on 17 August 2017, the listing of shares of the company was withdrawn from the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on 18 August 2017.{{Cite web|url=http://www.goldinppt.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/E-170816-Completion-of-Compulsory-Acquisition-Announcement.pdf|title=JOINT ANNOUNCEMENT RELATING TO PRIVATISATION OF GOLDIN PROPERTIES HOLDINGS LIMITED|last=|first=|date=2017-08-16|website=Goldin Properties Holdings Limited|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}} Goldin Group includes Goldin Properties Holdings Limited, Goldin Financial Holdings Limited, Goldin Equities Limited, Matsunichi Digital Holdings Limited,[http://www.goldingroup.com/en/about-us.php Goldin Real Estate Financial Holdings Limited – About Us] while Goldin Financial Holdings Limited is listed on the Main Board of Hong Kong Stock Exchange, stock code being 00530[http://www.etnet.com.hk/www/eng/stocks/realtime/quote.php?code=00530 etnet: 00530 Goldin Financial Holdings Limited]. In 2018, Pan Sutong was elected a member of the 13th National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference.{{Cite web|url=http://www.cppcc.gov.cn/zxww/2018/01/25/ARTI1516834749863530.shtml|title=中国人民政治协商会议第十三届全国委员会委员名单|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}} He received an honorary doctorate in business administration from [[Lingnan University (Hong Kong)|Lingnan University]] in November 2018. {{Cite web|url=https://www.ln.edu.hk/news/20181122/lingnan-university-confers-honorary-doctorates-upon-three-distinguished-individuals-2018|title=Lingnan University confers honorary doctorates upon three distinguished individuals|last=|first=|date=2018-11-22|website=Lingnan University|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}} ===Business career=== He is the Controlling Shareholder, the Chairman of the Board, the Chairman of the Nomination Committee and the Chairman of the Corporate Governance Committee of Goldin Financial Holdings Limited.Goldin Financial Holdings Limited – Group Introduction: Board of Directors [http://www.goldinfinancial.com/eng/about/member.html][http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=8487716&ticker=283:HK Bloomberg BusinessWeek] He is also the Controlling Shareholder, the non-executive Director and Chairman of the Board, the Chief Executive Officer, the Chairman of the Nomination Committee, the Chairman of the Executive Committee and a member of the Remuneration Committee of Goldin Properties Holdings Limited.Goldin Properties Holdings Limited – List of Directors and Their Roles and Functions [http://www.goldinppt.com/eng/index.html#/corporategovernace/listofdirectors/] According to Forbes 2018 World Billionaire's list, Pan was placed at number 334 with an estimated net worth of $5.5 billion.{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/billionaires/list/#version:static|title=The World's Billionaires|work=Forbes|access-date=2018-05-04|language=en}} As a polo lover, Pan Sutong is also the Chairman of the Hong Kong Polo Development and Promotion Federation (HKPDPF)Hong Kong Polo Development and Promotion Federation (HKPDPF) Aims to Promote Polo as a Spectator and Competitive Lifestyle Sport {{cite web |url=http://www.snowpoloworldcup.com/2012/en/media-section/press-releases/103-hong-kong-polo-development-and-promotion-federation-hkpdpf-aims-to-promote-polo-as-a-spectator-and-competitive-lifestyle-sport |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-10-22 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131023032332/http://www.snowpoloworldcup.com/2012/en/media-section/press-releases/103-hong-kong-polo-development-and-promotion-federation-hkpdpf-aims-to-promote-polo-as-a-spectator-and-competitive-lifestyle-sport |archivedate=2013-10-23 |df= }} and Vice President of the Federation of International Polo (FIP).Snow Polo World Cup 2013: Message from the President of Federation of International Polo(FIP) {{cite web |url=http://www.snowpoloworldcup.com/organisers/message-from-the-president-of-federation-of-international-polo-fip |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-10-22 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131023032336/http://www.snowpoloworldcup.com/organisers/message-from-the-president-of-federation-of-international-polo-fip |archivedate=2013-10-23 |df= }} In 2015, Pan made a donation to Lingnan University to establish the Pan Sutong Shanghai-Hong Kong Economic Policy Research Centre to strengthen research on issues related to the economic and financial development of Mainland China and Hong Kong. {{Cite web|url=http://www.ln.edu.hk/psec/activities_1.php|title=Pan Sutong Shanghai-Hong Kong Economic Policy Research Centre|website=www.ln.edu.hk|access-date=2018-05-08}} In 2017, Pan Sutong, Peter Lam Kin-ngok, Cheng Cheung-ling and Chanchai Ruayrungruang jointly founded the Belt and Road General Chamber of Commerce. {{Cite news|url=http://www.thestandard.com.hk/section-news.php?id=187414&sid=4|title=Chamber set up to ease Belt, Road path in SE Asia|last=|first=|date=2017-09-13|work=The Standard|access-date=2018-05-08}} ===Wine=== Pan Sutong is a [[wine]] lover. In 2011, Goldin Group bought the 40-acre [[SLOAN ESTATE]] winery in the [[Napa Valley]] from Stuart Sloan, planted to Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. The estate produces the flagship SLOAN and second label ASTERISK. The SLOAN 2002 and 2007 vintages were awarded 100 points by renowned wine critic Robert Parker. On 30 May 2013, the Group purchased three more châteaux in [[Bordeaux]], [[France]], namely Château Le Bon Pasteur in Pomerol, Château Rolland-Maillet in Saint-Émilion and Château Bertineau St-Vincent in Lalande-de-Pomerol.[http://www.thedrinksbusiness.com/2013/05/le-bon-pasteur-sold-to-asian-investor/ the drinks business: Le Bon Pasteur Sold to Asian Investor] The [[Château Le Bon Pasteur]] is a [[Pomerol AOC]] [[Bordeaux wine]] from world-renowned consulting oenologist [[Michel Rolland]]. As Goldin Financial’s long-term working partner,Michel Rolland facilitated this acquisition.Jeff Leve, [http://www.thewinecellarinsider.com/2013/05/first-major-bordeaux-chateau-sells-to-asian-investor-is-big-news/ "First Major Bordeaux Chateau Sells to Asian Investor is Big News!"], ''The Wine Cellar Insider'', May 30, 2013Lucy Shaw, [http://www.thedrinksbusiness.com/2013/05/le-bon-pasteur-sold-to-asian-investor/ "Le Bon Pasteur Sold to Asian Investor"], ''The Drinks Business'', May 31, 2013 Similar to SLOAN, despite the transfer of ownership, all the wine-making procedures and processes at the châteaux will remain the same and be done by the same staff. ===Polo=== [[File:SnowPoloWorldCup ball-throw.jpg|thumb|right|200px| Pan Sutong threw the ceremonial first ball at the Fortune Heights Snow Polo World Cup 2013]] [[File:GoldinGroupCharityDay.jpg|thumb|right|200px| Group picture taken in Goldin Group Charity Day held in Beaufort Polo Club with Prince William and Prince Harry’s teams]] Pan Sutong is the Chairman of the non-profit-making Hong Kong Polo Development and Promotion Federation. In December 2012, Pan Sutong was elected as Vice President of the Federation of International Polo in the FIP Annual General Meeting. [[Tianjin Goldin Metropolitan Polo Club]], which opened in November 2010,[http://www.goldingroup.com/en/our-business-polo.php "POLO: The Tianjin Goldin Metropolitan Polo Club opened in November 2010 as China’s largest and most prestigious polo club"], ''[[Goldin Group Website]]'' is owned by Pan Sutong's Goldin Group.John O'Sullivan, [http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/f6ace4c8-9da1-11e1-9a9e-00144feabdc0.html#axzz2YPKM0KkM "China: Wealthy elite revives the spirit of the emperors"], ''[[The Financial Times]]'', May 26, 2012 The Club has held a number of international polo tournaments since its opening in November 2010, including Goldin International Snow Polo Challenge 2011, Goldin Cold Cup 2011, Goldin U18 Cup 2011, Fortune Heights Snow Polo World Cup 2012-2017,[http://www.snowpoloworldcup.com/2012/en/tournament/snow-polo-world-cup Snow Polo World Cup 2012] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924103054/http://www.snowpoloworldcup.com/2012/en/tournament/snow-polo-world-cup |date=2015-09-24 }}[http://www.snowpoloworldcup.com/tournament/introduction Snow Polo World Cup 2013: Tournament Introduction] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131116060207/http://www.snowpoloworldcup.com/tournament/introduction/ |date=2013-11-16 }}[http://www.snowpoloworldcup.com/tournament/introduction Snow Polo World Cup 2014: Tournament Introduction] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131116060207/http://www.snowpoloworldcup.com/tournament/introduction/ |date=2013-11-16 }}{{Cite news|url = http://www.poloplus10.com/fip-fortune-heights-snow-polo-world-cup-the-biggest-snow-polo-event-in-the-world-45306/|title = FIP FORTUNE HEIGHTS SNOW POLO WORLD CUP The Biggest Snow Polo Event in the World|last = |first = |date = 2015-01-27|work = |access-date = 2016-01-25|via = }} Fortune Heights Super Nations Cup 2012,[http://www.supernationscup.com/tournament/introduction#.UmDyPHBBNBM Super Nations Cup 2012: Tournament Introduction] 2013[http://www.supernationscup.com/tournament/introduction#.UmD8GHBBNBM Super Nations Cup 2013: Tournament Introduction] and 2014,[http://www.supernationscup.com/2014/about/introduction/ Super Nations Cup 2014: Tournament Introduction] Maserati Metropolitan Polo Classic 2013[http://www.metropolitanpoloclassic.com/2013/tournament/introduction Maserati Metropolitan Polo Classic 2013: Tournament Introduction] and 2014,[http://www.metropolitanpoloclassic.com/tournament/introduction/ Maserati Metropolitan Polo Classic 2014: Tournament Introduction] and Metropolitan Intervarsity Polo 2013-2018.[http://www.metropolitanpoloclub.com/hotel/mip2013/introduction.php Metropolitan Intervarsity Polo 2013: Tournament Introduction][http://www.mpc-intervarsity.com/2014/tournament/introduction Metropolitan Intervarsity Polo 2014: Tournament Introduction] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20140918043019/http://www.mpc-intervarsity.com/2014/tournament/introduction |date=2014-09-18 }} [http://www.mpc-intervarsity.com/2015/?page_id=21 Metropolitan Intervarsity Polo 2015: Tournament Introduction] In June 2012, 2013, 2014 and 2015, Goldin Group also sponsored the Goldin Charity Day held in Beaufort Polo Club in England, which were participated by both Prince William and Prince Harry.[http://www.poloplus10.com/goldin-group-charity-polo-cup-piaget-wins-charity-cup-33040 Gloucestershire Festival of Polo 2014: Piaget wins Charity Cup] ===Horses=== [[File:HongKongClassicMile.JPG|thumb|right|200px| Gold-Fun crowned champion of Hong Kong Classic Mile 2013]] In 2011, Pan Sutong started participating in horse racing in Hong Kong and purchased a few high-priced thoroughbreds, including Tailwind, [[Gold-Fun]], [[Akeed Mofeed]], Giant Treasure,[http://www.hkjc.com/english/racing/mcs01_xml_newhorse.asp?SelType=NONH&selfile=20141027_000000_S_NONH.xml Hong Kong Jockey Club: Names of New Horses 27/10/2014] Obliterator,[http://www.hkjc.com/english/racing/mcs01_xml_newhorse.asp?SelType=NONH&selfile=20141219_000000_S_NONH.xml Hong Kong Jockey Club: Names of New Horses 19/12/2014] Consort,[http://www.hkjc.com/english/racing/horse.asp?HorseNo=v172 Hong Kong Jockey Club Horse Information: Consort] Gold Mount{{Cite web|url=http://www.hkjc.com/english/racing/Horse.asp?HorseNo=A112|title=GOLD MOUNT - Horses - Horse Racing - The Hong Kong Jockey Club|website=www.hkjc.com|access-date=2018-05-08}} and Gold Land{{Cite web|url=http://www.hkjc.com/english/racing/Horse.asp?HorseNo=A109|title=GOLD LAND - Horses - Horse Racing - The Hong Kong Jockey Club|website=www.hkjc.com|access-date=2018-05-08}}. According to news reports, Akeed Mofeed, sired by three-time Group 1 winner Dubawi,[http://www.hkjc.com/english/racinginfo/newhorse.asp?racedate=20130112&raceNo=10&brandNo=P125 The Hong Kong Jockey Club: Racing Information – Akeed Mofeed] was priced as high as 20 million Hong Kong dollars.[http://www.racingpost.com/news/horse-racing/hong-kong-akeed-mofeed-victorious-in-derby/1222858/#newsArchiveTabs=last7DaysNews Racing Post.com: Akeed Mofeed victorious in Derby for Gibson] Akeed Mofeed finished 4th in the Irish Derby 2012 and won the BMW Hong Kong Derby 2013.[http://www.racingpost.com/horses/horse_home.sd?horse_id=786709#topHorseTabs=horse_race_record&bottomHorseTabs=horse_form Racing Post.com: Akeed Mofeed Race Record] Akeed Mofeed is also the 1st runner-up of the G2 LONGINES Jockey Club Cup (2000m) at Sha Tin racecourse on Sunday, 17 November, losing only by a diminishing head to Endowing, the champion.{{Cite news |url=http://campaign.hkjc.com/en/2013-hkir/2013-hkir-news-details.aspx?in_file=hkir_news_2013111701856.html |title=Endowing steps up to beat the big guns in the G2 LONGINES Jockey Club Cup |publisher=Hong Kong Jockey Club |date=2013-11-17 |accessdate=2013-11-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131213193046/http://campaign.hkjc.com/en/2013-hkir/2013-hkir-news-details.aspx?in_file=hkir_news_2013111701856.html |archivedate=2013-12-13 |df= }} On 8 December 2013, Akeed Mofeed was crowned champion of G1 LONGINES Hong Kong Cup.{{Cite news |url=http://campaign.hkjc.com/en/2013-hkir/2013-hkir-news-details.aspx?in_file=hkir_news_2013120801807.html |title=Whyte back in the good books in LONGINES Hong Kong Cup |publisher=Hong Kong Jockey Club |date=2013-12-08 |accessdate=2013-12-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131213192808/http://campaign.hkjc.com/en/2013-hkir/2013-hkir-news-details.aspx?in_file=hkir_news_2013120801807.html |archivedate=2013-12-13 |df= }} Akeed Mofeed retired from racing on 6 June 2014 and stands as a stallion at owner Pan Sutong’s Goldin Farms, Lindsay Park in South Australia.{{Cite news|url=http://www.racingnetwork.com.au/hong-kong-champ-retired-to-stud-in-australia/tabid/83/newsid/19918/default.aspx |title= Hong Kong champ retired to stud in Australia |publisher=Racing Network |date=2014-06-06 |accessdate=2014-06-06}} Gold-Fun is sired by Le Vie Dei Colori, a fourteen-time winner including the champion of Premio Vittorio Di Capua (GI) of Italy. He is the champion of the Hong Kong Classic Mile 2013The Hong Kong Jockey Club News: Gibson talks about the performance of GOLD-FUN {{cite web |url=http://campaign.hkjc.com/en/2013-derby/2013-derby-news-details-form.aspx?in_file=derby_news_2013012301000.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-10-23 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029185916/http://campaign.hkjc.com/en/2013-derby/2013-derby-news-details-form.aspx?in_file=derby_news_2013012301000.html |archivedate=2013-10-29 |df= }} and the 2nd runner-up of BMW Hong Kong Derby 2013. On 1 October 2013, he was crowned champion of the National Day Cup 2013.[http://racing.hkjc.com/racing/Info/Meeting/Results/English/Local/20131001/ST/8 The Hong Kong Jockey Club: Racing Information – The National Day Cup] Gold-Fun continued his victory by winning the G2 BOCHK Wealth Management Jockey Club Mile on 17 November.{{Cite news |url=http://campaign.hkjc.com/en/2013-hkir/2013-hkir-news-details.aspx?in_file=hkir_news_2013111701901.html |title=Gold run for Gold-Fun in G2 BOCHK Wealth Management Jockey Club Mile |publisher=Hong Kong Jockey Club Racing News |date=2013-11-17 |accessdate=2013-11-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131213193541/http://campaign.hkjc.com/en/2013-hkir/2013-hkir-news-details.aspx?in_file=hkir_news_2013111701901.html |archivedate=2013-12-13 |df= }} Gold-Fun stamped his class on the HKG1 Queen's Silver Jubilee Cup (1400m) at Sha Tin racecourse on 16 March 2014, with a commanding half-length victory over the consistently gallant Dan Excel.{{Cite news |url=http://campaign.hkjc.com/en/2014-g1/news-item.aspx?in_file=/english/news/2014-03/news_2014031601836.html&b_cid=EWHPJSE__ |title=Whyte strikes Gold in Queen’s Silver Jubilee Cup |publisher=Hong Kong Jockey Club Racing News |date=2014-03-16 |accessdate=2014-03-17 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140317052239/http://campaign.hkjc.com/en/2014-g1/news-item.aspx?in_file=%2Fenglish%2Fnews%2F2014-03%2Fnews_2014031601836.html&b_cid=EWHPJSE__ |archivedate=2014-03-17 |df= }} Gold-Fun had defied a 130lbs burden and a troubled stretch run to land the spoils in the 1400m contest from a star-studded field of rivals, and claimed the trophy of the Celebration Cup held on 5 October 2014.{{Cite news|url = http://www.hkjc.com/english/corporate/racing_news_item.asp?in_file=/english/news/2014-10/news_2014100501714.html|title = Gold-Fun surges to HKG3 Celebration Cup triumph|last = |first = |date = 2014-10-05|work = |access-date = 2016-01-25|via = |publisher = Hong Kong Jockey Club Racing News}} On 15 February 2015, Gold-Fun gained his first victory at a distance short of 1400m at HKG1 1200M The Chairman's Sprint Prize, winning a short-head from Aerovelocity.{{Cite news|url = http://www.hkjc.com/english/corporate/racing_news_item.asp?in_file=/english/news/2015-02/news_2015021501718.html|title = Soumillon delivers Gold in Chairman’s Sprint Prize thriller|last = |first = |date = 2015-02-15|work = |access-date = 2016-01-25|via = |publisher = Hong Kong Jockey Club Racing News}} Gold-Fun continued his victory by winning the G2 BOCHK Wealth Management Jockey Club Sprint from Not Listenin’tome and Peniaphobia.{{Cite news|url = http://www.hkjc.com/english/corporate/racing_news_item.asp?in_file=/english/news/2015-11/news_2015112101834.html|title = Gold for Soumillon in BOCHK Wealth Management Jockey Club Sprint|last = |first = |date = 2015-11-27|work = |access-date = 2016-01-25|via = |publisher = Hong Kong Jockey Club Racing News}} On 31 January 2016, Giant Treasure claimed his first top-flight victory at the G1 Stewards’ Cup (1600m), winning by a short-head over Luger.{{Cite news|url = http://www.hkjc.com/english/corporate/racing_news_item.asp?in_file=/english/news/2016-01/news_2016013101759.html|title = Giant Treasure plunders Stewards’ Cup|last = |first = |date = 2016-01-31|work = Hong Kong Jockey Club Racing News|access-date = 2016-02-16|via = }} Goldin Australia Pty Ltd, a subsidiary of Pan Sutong’s Goldin Group, announced on 12 September 2013 the completion of its acquisition of Lindsay Park Stud in Barossa Valley, South Australia, an esteemed 1257.5-acre horse breeding and training ground, for breeding top thoroughbred racehorses.{{Cite news|url=http://www.barossaherald.com.au/story/1781880/new-beginning-for-lindsay-park/ |title=收購澳洲牧場 潘蘇通啟動頂級純種馬匹繁育事業 |publisher=Herald |date=2013-09-18 |accessdate=2013-11-15}} On 28 March 2018, Gold Mount won the Class 1 Happy Valley Vase Handicap (1800m), with a head to spare over a swooping Eagle Way. {{Cite web|url=http://racingnews.hkjc.com/english/2018/03/29/sanna-stars-in-saddle-as-gold-mount-takes-happy-valley-vase/|title=Sanna stars in saddle as Gold Mount takes Happy Valley Vase – Racing News – The Hong Kong Jockey Club|website=racingnews.hkjc.com|access-date=2018-05-08}} ===Celebrity=== In 2005, Pan Sutong's Matsunichi engaged [[Olympic Games|Olympic]] Gold Medalist [[Michael Phelps]] as the Spokesperson of Matsunichi MP3 Player. According to news reports, Michael Phelps chose to collaborate with Matsunichi because he enjoyed listening to music to help him relax as well as focus before competition. Apart from doing TV commercials and attending product launching press conferences, as a spokesperson Michael Phelps was often seen using Matsunichi MP3 Player at poolside before competition.[http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/tech/news/2005-03-10-phelps-usat_x.htm USATODAY: Phelps snares endorsement for MP3 players] ===Personal life=== He resides in [[Hong Kong]]. ===Football club=== He owned a professional football club [[Guangzhou Matsunichi F.C.]] between 1995 and 2000.[http://sports.sohu.com/20150914/n421106383.shtml 甲A广州松日老板建中国第一高楼 身价曾达千亿] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Pan, Sutong}} [[Category:Hong Kong entrepreneurs]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Guangdong]] [[Category:People from Shaoguan]] [[Category:Hakka people]] [[Category:Hong Kong people of Hakka descent]] [[Category:1963 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Chinese football chairmen and investors]]

Ukraine Hryvnia to Euro Member Countries|website=xe.com|accessdate=26 November 2018}}{{cite web |url= http://finance.bigmir.net/budget/72072-Kabmin-utverdil-novye-zarplaty-dlja-Poroshenko-i-Grojsmana |date= 1 August 2016 |script-title= ru:Кабмин утвердил новые зарплаты для Порошенко и Гройсмана |publisher= bigmir.net |language= ru |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20160802190844/http://finance.bigmir.net/budget/72072-Kabmin-utverdil-novye-zarplaty-dlja-Poroshenko-i-Grojsmana |archivedate= 2 August 2016 |df= dmy-all }} | office4 = [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] | convocation4 = [[3rd Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada|3rd convocation]] | constituency4 = [[Independent (politician)|Independent]], [[Vinnytsia Oblast]],
