{{cite news |url=http://www.euronews.com/2014/06/07/poroshenko-offers-escape-for-rebels-but-no-compromise-over-weapons/ |title=Poroshenko offers escape for rebels but no compromise over weapons |publisher=Euronews |date=7 June 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140701202739/http://www.euronews.com/2014/06/07/poroshenko-offers-escape-for-rebels-but-no-compromise-over-weapons/ |archivedate=1 July 2014 |deadurl=no }}
{{cite news |url=http://www.pravda.com.ua/articles/2014/06/7/7028330/ |script-title=uk:Промова президента України під час церемонії інавгурації. Повний текст |trans-title=Speech by President of Ukraine during the inauguration ceremony. Full text |newspaper=[[Ukrayinska Pravda]] |date=7 June 2014 |language=uk |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140607090456/http://www.pravda.com.ua/articles/2014/06/7/7028330/ |archivedate=7 June 2014 |df=dmy-all }} [[File:Petro Porochenko au Conseil de l’Europe Strasbourg 26 juin 2014 03.jpg|thumb|Poroshenko delivers a speech to the [[Council of Europe]] parliamentary assembly in [[Strasbourg]], 26 June 2014.]] The inauguration was attended by about 50 foreign delegations, including US Vice President [[Joe Biden]], [[President of Poland]] [[Bronisław Komorowski]], [[President of Belarus]] [[Alexander Lukashenko]], [[President of Lithuania]] [[Dalia Grybauskaitė]], [[President of Switzerland]] and the [[OSCE]] Chairman-in-Office [[Didier Burkhalter]], [[President of Germany]] [[Joachim Gauck]], [[President of Georgia]] [[Giorgi Margvelashvili]], [[Prime Minister of Canada]] [[Stephen Harper]], [[Prime Minister of Hungary]] [[Viktor Orbán]], [[President of the European Council]] [[Herman Van Rompuy]], the OSCE Secretary General [[Lamberto Zannier]], [[United Nations Department of Political Affairs|UN Under-Secretary-General for Political Affairs]] [[Jeffrey D. Feltman|Jeffrey Feldman]], [[Ministry of Culture of the People's Republic of China|China's Minister of Culture]] [[Cai Wu]] and [[Ambassador of Russia to Ukraine]] [[Mikhail Zurabov]]{{cite news|newspaper=Ukrayinska Pravda|url=http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2014/06/7/7028262/|script-title=uk:На інавгурацію Порошенка прибудуть делегації з 56 країн|trans-title=At the inauguration Poroshenko come delegations from 56 countries|date=7 June 2014|accessdate=7 June 2014|language=uk|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140609232456/http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2014/06/7/7028262/|archivedate=9 June 2014|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=http://www.euronews.com/2014/06/07/ukraine-international-recognition-for-president-poroshenko/ |title=Ukraine: International recognition for President Poroshenko |publisher=[[Euronews]] |date=7 June 2014 |accessdate=7 June 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140708222139/http://www.euronews.com/2014/06/07/ukraine-international-recognition-for-president-poroshenko/ |archivedate=8 July 2014 |df=dmy }} Former [[Prime Minister of Ukraine]] [[Yulia Tymoshenko]] was also present. After the inauguration ceremony Tymoshenko said about Poroshenko "I think Ukraine has found a very powerful additional factor of stability".{{cite news|url=http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2014/06/7/7028359|script-title=uk:Тимошенко: президент Порошенко – потужний фактор стабільності|trans-title=Tymoshenko: President Poroshenko – a powerful factor of stability|newspaper=Ukrayinska Pravda|date=7 June 2014|accessdate=7 June 2014|language=uk|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140609232601/http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2014/06/7/7028359/|archivedate=9 June 2014|df=dmy-all}} ===Domestic policy=== ====Peace plan for Eastern Ukraine==== {{main|2014 pro-Russian unrest in Ukraine}} At the time of his inauguration, [[2014 pro-Russian conflict in Ukraine|armed pro-Russian rebels]], after [[Donbass status referendums, 2014|disputed referendums]], had declared the independence of the separatist [[Donetsk People's Republic]] and [[Lugansk People's Republic]] and controlled a large part of [[Eastern Ukraine]], but were largely considered to be illegitimate by the international community. After the inauguration, Poroshenko launched a "peace" plan envisioned to garner the recognition of the [[Ukrainian presidential election, 2014|presidential elections in Ukraine]] by Russia, consisting of a cease-fire with the separatists (named "terrorists" by Poroshenko himself) and the establishment of a humanitarian corridor for civilians ("who are not involved in the conflict").{{cite news|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/208898.html |title=Poroshenko doesn't rule out roundtable in Donetsk involving parties to conflict |agency=[[Interfax-Ukraine]] |date=12 June 2014 |accessdate=12 June 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140701044007/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/208898.html |archivedate=1 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} Poroshenko warned that he had a "Plan B" if the initial peace plan was rejected. ====Reforms in Ukraine==== [[File:Петр Порошенко.jpg|300px|thumb]] ====Constitutional reform==== ====Decentralization of power==== In mid-June Poroshenko started the process of amending [[Ukraine's constitution]] to achieve Ukraine's [[Decentralization#Administrative|administrative decentralization]]. According to Poroshenko (on 16 June 2014) this was "a key element of [[Petro Poroshenko#Peace plan for Eastern Ukraine|the peace plan]]".{{cite news|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/209550.html |title=Amendments to Ukraine's Constitution to be tabled in parliament this week – Poroshenko |agency=[[Interfax-Ukraine]] |date=16 June 2014 |archivedate=1 July 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140701043708/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/209550.html |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} In his draft constitutional amendments of June 2014 proposed changing the [[administrative divisions of Ukraine]], which should include regions (replacing the current [[Oblasts of Ukraine|oblasts]]), districts and "[[Administrative divisions of Ukraine#United territorial communities|hromadas]]" (united territorial communities).{{cite news|agency=[[Interfax-Ukraine]] |url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/211043.html |title=Poroshenko suggests granting status of regions to Crimea, Kyiv, Sevastopol, creating new political subdivision of 'community' |date=26 June 2014 |accessdate=26 June 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140701043549/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/211043.html |archivedate=1 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} In these amendments he also proposed that "Village, city, district and regional administrations will be able to determine the status of the [[Russian language]] and other [[Languages of Ukraine|national minority languages of Ukraine]] in accordance with the procedure established by the law and within the borders of their administrative and territorial units".{{cite news|date=26 June 2014 |url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/211041.html |title=Authorities in Ukrainian regions may be allowed to determine status of national minority languages |agency=Interfax-Ukraine |accessdate=26 June 2014 |archivedate=1 July 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140701043340/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/211041.html |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} He proposed that [[Ukrainian language|Ukrainian]] remained the only state language of Ukraine. Poroshenko further proposed to create the post of presidential representatives who would supervise the enforcement of the Ukrainian constitution and laws and the observation of human rights and freedoms in [[Oblasts of Ukraine|oblasts]] and [[Raions of Ukraine|raions]]/[[Raions of cities in Ukraine|raions of cities]]. In case of an "emergency situation or martial law regime" they will "guide and organize" in the territories they are stationed in.{{cite news|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/211030.html |title=Ukrainian president proposes to appoint representatives to regions |agency=Interfax-Ukraine |date=26 June 2014 |accessdate=26 June 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140701040905/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/211030.html |archivedate=1 July 2014 |df=dmy }} [[Batkivshchyna]], a key coalition partner in the [[First Yatsenyuk Government|Yatsenyuk Government]], came out against the plan.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ukraine-crisis-defence-idUSKBN0F80CF20140703 |title=Ukraine's Poroshenko names new defence chiefs in shake-up |agency=Reuters |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140703140826/https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/07/03/us-ukraine-crisis-defence-idUSKBN0F80CF20140703 |archivedate=3 July 2014 |deadurl=no |date=3 July 2014 |df=dmy }} {{why?|date=June 2018}} He has repeatedly spoken out against [[federalization]]."[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/250254.html Documents signed in Minsk don't envision federalization, autonomy for Donbas – Poroshenko] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150224215420/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/250254.html|date=24 February 2015}}". [[Interfax-Ukraine]]. 12 February 2015.[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/273848.html Poroshenko rules out federalization of Ukraine] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150624014948/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/273848.html |date=24 June 2015 }}. [[Interfax-Ukraine]]. 23 June 2015.
[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/274559.html Ukraine to remain unitary state after constitution is amended – Poroshenko] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150627014147/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/274559.html |date=27 June 2015 }}. [[Interfax-Ukraine]]. 26 June 2015. and does not seek to increase [[President of Ukraine#Duties and powers|his presidential powers]].[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/275000.html Semi-presidential form of government is optimal for Ukraine – Poroshenko] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150802010136/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/275000.html |date=2 August 2015 }}. [[Interfax-Ukraine]]. 30 June 2015. 1 July 2015 decentralization draft law gave local authorities the right to oversee how their tax revenues are spent.[http://www.rferl.mobi/a/ukraine-constitution-changes-poroshenko-/27104769.html Poroshenko Unveils Constitutional Changes], [[Radio Free Europe]] (1 July 2015) The draft law did not give an [[Autonomous administrative division|autonomous status]] to [[Donbass]], as demanded by the pro-Russian rebels there, but gave the region partial self-rule for three years. ====Dissolution of Parliament==== {{Main|Ukrainian parliamentary election, 2014}} On 25 August 2014, Poroshenko called a [[snap election]] to the [[Verkhovna Rada]] (Ukraine's parliament), [[Ukrainian parliamentary election, 2014|to be held 26 October 2014]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2014-08-25/ukraine-president-poroshenko-calls-snap-general-election.html|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140825232937/http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2014-08-25/ukraine-president-poroshenko-calls-snap-general-election.html|archivedate=25 August 2014|title=Ukraine President Poroshenko Calls Snap General Election|publisher=[[Bloomberg News]] |date=25 August 2014}}{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-28931054 |title=Ukraine crisis: President calls snap vote amid fighting |publisher=BBC News |date=25 August 2014 |accessdate=30 August 2014 |archivedate=27 August 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140827104753/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-28931054 |df=dmy }} According to him this was necessary "to purify the Rada of the mainstay of [former president] [[Viktor Yanukovych]]". These deputies, Poroshenko said, "clearly do not represent the people who elected them". Poroshenko also said that these Rada deputies were responsible for "the [[Dictatorship laws in Ukraine|[January 2014] Dictatorship laws]] that took the lives of the [[Heavenly hundred]]". Poroshenko also stated that many of the (then) current MPs were "direct sponsors and accomplices or at least sympathizers of militant-separatists".[http://www.upi.com/Top_News/World-News/2014/08/25/Ukrainian-President-dissolves-Parliament-announces-early-elections/3261408995210/ Ukrainian President dissolves Parliament, announces early elections] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140831062559/http://www.upi.com/Top_News/World-News/2014/08/25/Ukrainian-President-dissolves-Parliament-announces-early-elections/3261408995210/ |date=31 August 2014 }}, [[United Press International]] (25 August 2014)
{{cite news |url=http://www.themoscowtimes.com/news/article/ukraine-s-petro-poroshenko-announces-new-parliamentary-elections/505837.html |title=Ukraine's Petro Poroshenko Dissolves Parliament, Sets Election Date |work=[[The Moscow Times]] |date=26 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140827121528/http://www.themoscowtimes.com/news/article/ukraine-s-petro-poroshenko-announces-new-parliamentary-elections/505837.html |archivedate=27 August 2014 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}
[https://web.archive.org/web/20140829180501/http://www.president.gov.ua/en/news/31081.html President's address on the occasion of early parliamentary elections of 26 October], [[Presidential Administration of Ukraine]] (25 August 2014) Poroshenko had pressed for the elections since his victory in the [[2014 Ukrainian presidential election|May 2014 presidential election]].{{cite news|accessdate=30 August 2014 |url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/211079.html |title=Poroshenko hopes early parliamentary elections in Ukraine will take place in October |agency=[[Interfax-Ukraine]] |date=26 June 2014 |archivedate=27 October 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141027041537/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/211079.html |df=dmy }}{{cite news|accessdate=30 August 2014 |date=19 June 2014 |url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/210172.html |title=Poroshenko hopes for early parliamentary elections in Ukraine this fall – presidential envoy |agency=[[Interfax-Ukraine]] |archivedate=18 October 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141018230314/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/210172.html |df=dmy }}{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/ukrainians-head-to-the-polls-to-elect-a-new-president-except-in-the-restive-east/2014/05/25/2680fad4-e9f7-4118-923e-852b01351b39_story.html|title=In Ukrainian election, chocolate tycoon Poroshenko claims victory|work=[[The Washington Post]]|date=25 May 2014|accessdate=30 August 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140904072819/http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/ukrainians-head-to-the-polls-to-elect-a-new-president-except-in-the-restive-east/2014/05/25/2680fad4-e9f7-4118-923e-852b01351b39_story.html|archivedate=4 September 2014|df=dmy-all}} On 27 August 2014, the party congress of [[National Alliance of Freedom and Ukrainian patriotism "OFFENSIVE"|All-Ukrainian Party of Peace and Unity]] adopted a new name: "[[Petro Poroshenko Bloc "Solidarity"|Petro Poroshenko Bloc]]" (BPP).{{cite news|date=27 August 2014 |accessdate=30 August 2014 |url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/220240.html |title=Poroshenko wants coalition to be formed before parliamentary elections |agency=[[Interfax-Ukraine]] |archivedate=3 July 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140703140826/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/220240.html |df=dmy }}
{{cite news|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/220216.html |title=Solidarity Party to be renamed Bloc of Petro Poroshenko – congress |agency=[[Interfax-Ukraine]] |date=27 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140831002633/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/220216.html |archivedate=31 August 2014 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}{{cite news|language=uk|url=http://www.pravda.com.ua/rus/articles/2014/06/6/7028205/view_print/|title=Петро Порошенко виходить на роботу|trans-title=Poroshenko goes to work|work=[[Ukrayinska Pravda]]|date=6 June 2014|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303230000/http://www.pravda.com.ua/rus/articles/2014/06/6/7028205/view_print/|archivedate=3 March 2016|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|url=http://www.pravda.com.ua/articles/2014/05/16/7025568|script-title=uk:Порошенко і порожнеча|date=16 May 2014|accessdate=30 August 2014|language=uk|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140830053322/http://www.pravda.com.ua/articles/2014/05/16/7025568/|archivedate=30 August 2014|df=dmy-all}} In 2015, the Petro Poroshenko Bloc was renamed in "[[Petro Poroshenko Bloc "Solidarity"]]".{{cite news|url=http://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-politics/1823650-bloc_of_petro_poroshenko_to_change_name_329651.html|title=Bloc of Petro Poroshenko to change name|work=Ukrinform.net|date=10 March 2015|accessdate=6 November 2015}} ====Nuclear weapons==== On 13 December 2014 Poroshenko stated that he did not want [[Nuclear weapons and Ukraine|Ukraine to become a nuclear power again]].[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/economic/239730.html Ukraine has no ambitions to become nuclear power again – Poroshenko] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141214005906/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/economic/239730.html |date=14 December 2014 }}, [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (13 December 2014) ====Decommunization and deoligarchization==== [[File:Петро Порошенко під час виступу у Полтаві (2016 рік).jpg|thumb|302x302px|Petro Poroshenko in Poltava]] On 15 May 2015 Poroshenko signed a bill into law that started a six months period for [[Decommunization in Ukraine|the removal of communist monuments and the mandatory renaming of streets and other public places and settlements with a name related to]] Communism.[http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2015/05/15/7068057/ Poroshenko signed the laws about decommunization] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160423181130/http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2015/05/15/7068057/ |date=23 April 2016 }}. [[Ukrayinska Pravda]]. 15 May 2015
[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/265988.html Poroshenko signs laws on denouncing Communist, Nazi regimes] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160819162411/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/265988.html |date=19 August 2016 }}, [[Interfax-Ukraine]]. 15 May 20
[http://www.unian.info/politics/1078854-poroshenko-time-for-ukraine-to-resolutely-get-rid-of-communist-symbols.html Poroshenko: Time for Ukraine to resolutely get rid of Communist symbols] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150518092853/http://www.unian.info/politics/1078854-poroshenko-time-for-ukraine-to-resolutely-get-rid-of-communist-symbols.html |date=18 May 2015 }}, [[UNIAN]]. 17 May 2015
[https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-32267075 Goodbye, Lenin: Ukraine moves to ban communist symbols] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160307200441/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-32267075 |date=7 March 2016 }}, [[BBC News]] (14 April 2015) According to Poroshenko "I did what I had to"; adding "Ukraine as a state has done its job, then historians should work, while the government should take care of the future". Poroshenko believes that the [[Political repression in the Soviet Union|communist repression]] and [[holodomor]] of the [[Soviet Union]] are on par with the [[Nazi atrocities|Nazi crimes]] of the 1940s.{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.com/ukrainian/politics/2015/05/150517_poroshenko_red_terror_she|script-title=uk:Порошенко: час очистити Україну від комуністичних символів|trans-title=Poroshenko: time to clear Ukraine of communist symbols|language=uk|work=[[BBC Ukrainian]]|date=17 May 2015|accessdate=30 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160113164921/http://www.bbc.com/ukrainian/politics/2015/05/150517_poroshenko_red_terror_she|archivedate=13 January 2016|df=dmy-all}} The legislation (Poroshenko signed on 15 May 2015) also provides "public recognition to anyone who fought for [[Ukrainian independence]] in the 20th century","[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/apr/20/ukraine-decommunisation-law-soviet Ukraine to rewrite Soviet history with controversial 'decommunisation' laws ] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160723085903/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/apr/20/ukraine-decommunisation-law-soviet |date=23 July 2016 }}". ''[[The Guardian]]''. 20 April 2015. including the controversial [[Ukrainian Insurgent Army]] (UPA) combatants led by [[Roman Shukhevych]] and [[Stepan Bandera]]. Poroshenko said in an interview with Germany's ''Bild'' newspaper that "If I am elected, I'll wipe the slate clean and will sell the [[Roshen]] concern. As president of Ukraine, I will and want to only focus on the well-being of the nation.""[https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2014-04-02/poroshenko-to-sell-roshen-if-elected-ukrainian-president-bild Poroshenko to Sell Roshen If Elected Ukrainian President: Bild] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170322075302/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2014-04-02/poroshenko-to-sell-roshen-if-elected-ukrainian-president-bild |date=22 March 2017 }}". [[Bloomberg News|Bloomberg]]. 2 April 2014. On 23 March 2015 Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko accepted the resignation of billionaire [[Ihor Kolomoyskyi|Ihor Kolomoisky]] as governor of [[Dnipropetrovsk Oblast|Dnipro region]] over the control of oil companies.{{Cite news|title=Powerful Ukrainian Governor Kolomoyskiy Resigns|url=http://www.rferl.org/content/ukraine-kolomoisky-/26919383.html|newspaper=RadioFreeEurope/RadioLiberty|date=25 March 2015|access-date=9 June 2015}} "There will be no more oligarchs in Ukraine," Poroshenko said adding that "oligarchs must pay more [taxes] than the middle class and more than small business." The president underscored that "the program of de-oligarchization will be put into life". Poroshenko promised that he will fight against the [[Ukrainian oligarchs]].{{cite web|url=http://www.5.ua/polityka/V-Ukraini-bilshe-ne-bude-oliharkhiv--Poroshenko-82237.html|title=IN UKRAINE THERE WILL BE NO MORE OLIGARCHS – POROSHENKO|publisher=5.ua|date=30 May 2015|accessdate=2015-05-30|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150601235924/http://www.5.ua/polityka/V-Ukraini-bilshe-ne-bude-oliharkhiv--Poroshenko-82237.html|archivedate=1 June 2015|df=dmy-all}} ====Corruption==== Corruption is a widespread and growing [[Corruption in Ukraine|problem in Ukrainian society]]. Poroshenko has signed a decree to create the [[Anti-Corruption Bureau|National Anti-Corruption Bureau of Ukraine]] to comply with the requirements of the [[International Monetary Fund]]. ===Foreign policy=== {{see also|List of international presidential trips made by Petro Poroshenko}} [[File:Barack Obama meets with Petro Poroshenko, June 5th 2014.jpg|thumb|U.S. President [[Barack Obama]] meets with Poroshenko, June 2014.]] ====United States==== On 7 December 2015 Poroshenko had a meeting with U.S. Vice President [[Joe Biden]] in Kiev to discuss Ukrainian-American cooperation.{{cite web|url=http://nv.ua/ukr/ukraine/politics/zustrich-poroshenka-i-bajdena-osnovni-pidsumki-84433.html|title=Meeting Poroshenko and Biden: main results|publisher=nv.ua|date=8 December 2015|accessdate=2015-12-08|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151209032739/http://nv.ua/ukr/ukraine/politics/zustrich-poroshenka-i-bajdena-osnovni-pidsumki-84433.html|archivedate=9 December 2015|df=dmy-all}} He met [[Donald Trump]] in June 2017; the [[British Broadcasting Corporation|BBC]] accused him of paying Trump's lawyer [[Michael Cohen (lawyer)|Michael Cohen]] between 400,000 and 600,000 dollars to organize this meeting.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-44215656|title=Ukraine 'paid Trump lawyer for talks'|first=Paul|last=Wood|date=23 May 2018|publisher=|accessdate=26 November 2018|via=www.bbc.com}} ====Russia==== In June 2014 Poroshenko forbade any [[Russia–Ukraine relations|cooperation with Russia]] in the military sphere.{{cite news|url=http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2014/06/16/7029263/ |script-title=uk:Порошенко заборонив будь-яку співпрацю з Росією у військовій сфері |trans-title=Poroshenko forbade any cooperation with Russia in the military sphere |newspaper=''[[Ukrayinska Pravda]]'' |date=16 June 2014 |accessdate=16 June 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140617023142/http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2014/06/16/7029263/ |archivedate=17 June 2014 |language=uk |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} At the [[Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe]] on 26 June 2014 Poroshenko stated that [[Russia–Ukraine relations|bilateral relations with Russia]] cannot be normalized unless Russia undoes its unilateral [[Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation|annexation of]] [[Crimea]] and [[2014 Crimean crisis|returns its control of Crimea]] to Ukraine.{{cite news|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/211091.html |title=Ukraine cannot normalize relations with Russia without return of Crimea, says Poroshenko |agency=[[Interfax-Ukraine]] |date=26 June 2014 |accessdate=26 June 2014 |archivedate=27 June 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140627221848/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/211091.html |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} On [[Petro Poroshenko#Peace plan for Eastern Ukraine|Poroshenko's June 2014 Peace plan for Eastern Ukraine]] Russian Foreign Minister [[Sergei Lavrov]] commented "it looks like an [[ultimatum]]".{{cite news |url=http://www.aljazeerah.info/News/2014/June/22%20n/Poroshenko%20Warns%20of%20Detailed%20Plan%20B%20If%20Ukraine%20Ceasefire%20Fails,%20Gets%20Limited%20Support%20from%20Putin,%20June%2022,%202014.htm |title=Poroshenko warns of 'detailed Plan B' if Ukraine ceasefire fails |publisher=[[Al Jazeera]] |date=22 June 2014 |deadurl=no |archivedate=1 July 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140701211805/http://www.aljazeerah.info/News/2014/June/22%20n/Poroshenko%20Warns%20of%20Detailed%20Plan%20B%20If%20Ukraine%20Ceasefire%20Fails%2C%20Gets%20Limited%20Support%20from%20Putin%2C%20June%2022%2C%202014.htm |df=dmy }} On 26 August 2014 Poroshenko met with Russian President [[Vladimir Putin]] in [[Minsk]] where Putin called on Ukraine not to [[War in Donbass#Government push into Donetsk and Luhansk cities|escalate its offensive]]. Poroshenko responded by demanding Russia halt [[2014 Russian military intervention in Ukraine#Eastern Ukraine|its supplying of arms to separatist fighters]]. He said his country wanted a political compromise and promised the interests of Russian-speaking people in [[eastern Ukraine]] would be considered.{{cite news|title=Eastern Ukraine tensions figure in Putin and Poroshenko talks |url=http://www.moscownews.net/index.php/sid/225119533 |date=26 August 2014 |accessdate=28 August 2014 |publisher=Moscow News |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 September 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140903063542/http://www.moscownews.net/index.php/sid/225119533 |df=dmy }} ====European Union==== [[File:Poroschenko Merkel and Biden Security Conference February 2015.jpg|thumb|Poroshenko with [[Angela Merkel]] and [[Joe Biden]], 7 February 2015.]] The [[European Union]] (EU) and Ukraine signed the economic part of the [[Ukraine–European Union Association Agreement]] on 27 June 2014.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-28052645 |title=EU signs pacts with Ukraine, Georgia and Moldova |publisher=BBC News |date=27 June 2014 |accessdate=27 June 2014 |archivedate=27 June 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140627210422/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-28052645 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} Poroshenko stated that the day was "Ukraine's most historic day since [[Declaration of Independence of Ukraine|independence in 1991]]", describing it as a "symbol of faith and unbreakable will". He saw the signing as the start of preparations for [[Ukrainian EU Membership]]. ====NATO==== At his speech at the opening session of [[8th Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada|the new parliament]] on 27 November 2014 Poroshenko stated "we've decided to return to the course of [[Ukraine-NATO relations|NATO integration]]" because "[[Foreign relations of Ukraine#Western relations|the nonalignment status of Ukraine proclaimed in 2010]] couldn't guarantee our security and territorial integrity".[https://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/28/world/europe/a-tilt-toward-nato-in-ukraine-as-parliament-meets.html?action=click&contentCollection=Europe&module=RelatedCoverage®ion=Marginalia&pgtype=article A Tilt Toward NATO in Ukraine as Parliament Meets] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170322074839/https://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/28/world/europe/a-tilt-toward-nato-in-ukraine-as-parliament-meets.html?action=click&contentCollection=Europe&module=RelatedCoverage®ion=Marginalia&pgtype=article |date=22 March 2017 }}, [[The Wall Street Journal]] (27 November 2014) The Ukrainian parliament on 23 December 2014 voted 303 to 8 to repeal a 2010 bill that had made Ukraine a non-aligned state in a bill submitted by Poroshenko.{{cite news|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/241388.html|title=Ukraine has no alternative to Euro-Atlantic integration – Poroshenko|work=[[Interfax-Ukraine]]|date=23 December 2014|accessdate=30 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304060210/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/241388.html|archivedate=4 March 2016|df=dmy-all}}
{{cite news|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/241359.html|title=Ukraine abolishes its non-aligned status – law|work=Interfax-Ukraine|date=23 December 2014|accessdate=30 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141224003612/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/241359.html|archivedate=24 December 2014|df=dmy-all}}
{{cite news|url=http://www.euronews.com/2014/12/23/ukraine-s-complicated-path-to-nato-membership/|title=Ukraine's complicated path to NATO membership|work=[[Euronews]]|date=23 December 2014|accessdate=30 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304070543/http://www.euronews.com/2014/12/23/ukraine-s-complicated-path-to-nato-membership/|archivedate=4 March 2016|df=dmy-all}}
{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/24/world/europe/ukraine-parliament-nato-vote.html?_r=2|title=Ukraine Takes Step Toward Joining NATO|work=[[New York Times]]|date=23 December 2014|accessdate=30 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170322075205/https://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/24/world/europe/ukraine-parliament-nato-vote.html?_r=2|archivedate=22 March 2017|df=dmy-all}}
{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/ukraine-ends-nonaligned-status-earning-quick-rebuke-from-russia-1419339226|title=Ukraine Ends 'Nonaligned' Status, Earning Quick Rebuke From Russia|work=[[The Wall Street journal]]|date=23 December 2014|accessdate=30 March 2016|subscription=true|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304222433/http://www.wsj.com/articles/ukraine-ends-nonaligned-status-earning-quick-rebuke-from-russia-1419339226|archivedate=4 March 2016|df=dmy-all}} On 29 December 2014 Poroshenko vowed to hold a [[Ukrainian NATO membership referendum|referendum on joining NATO]].{{cite news|url=http://www.euronews.com/2014/12/30/new-year-new-hope-as-ukraine-paves-way-for-nato-membership/|title=New Year, new hope as Ukraine paves way for NATO membership|work=[[Euronews]]|date=30 December 2014|accessdate=30 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304075515/http://www.euronews.com/2014/12/30/new-year-new-hope-as-ukraine-paves-way-for-nato-membership/|archivedate=4 March 2016|df=dmy-all}} On 22 September 2015 Poroshenko claimed that "Russia's aggressive actions" proved need for the [[enlargement of NATO]] and that the Ukrainian referendum on joining NATO would be held after "every condition for the Ukrainian compliance with NATO membership criteria" was met by "reforming our country".{{cite news|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/291713.html|title=Russia's actions prove need for NATO expansion – Poroshenko|work=Interfax-Ukraine|date=22 September 2015|accessdate=30 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160408080426/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/291713.html|archivedate=8 April 2016|df=dmy-all}}
{{cite news|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/291691.html|title=Decision on referendum regarding Ukraine's membership in NATO to be made after reforms – Poroshenko|work=Interfax-Ukraine|date=22 September 2015|accessdate=30 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160408100326/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/291691.html|archivedate=8 April 2016|df=dmy-all}}
{{cite news|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/291686.html|title=Ukraine-NATO cooperation is crucially important for global security due to Russian aggression – Poroshenko|work=Interfax-Ukraine|date=22 September 2015|accessdate=30 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160408105433/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/291686.html|archivedate=8 April 2016|df=dmy-all}} [[File:Petro Poroshenko's visit to Serbia - 2018 (1530619141).jpg|thumb|President of Ukraine Petro Porosenko with Serbian Prime Minister [[Ana Brnabić]], [[Belgrade]] July 2018]] On 2 February 2017, in an interview with [[Funke Mediengruppe]], Poroshenko announced he was planning a referendum on whether Ukraine should join NATO.[http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/02/nato-calls-russia-stop-violence-ukraine-170202054257166.html NATO calls on Russia to stop violence in Ukraine] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170224221639/http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/02/nato-calls-russia-stop-violence-ukraine-170202054257166.html |date=24 February 2017 }}, [[Al Jazeera]] (2 February 2017) ====International==== Poroshenko was criticized by [[Committee to Protect Journalists]] for signing a decree which banned 41 international journalists and bloggers from entering Ukraine for one year, being labeled as threats to national security.{{cite web|url=https://cpj.org/2015/09/ukraine-bans-41-international-journalists-and-blog.php|title=Ukraine bans 41 international journalists and bloggers|work=CPJ|date=16 September 2015|accessdate=10 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160113164920/https://cpj.org/2015/09/ukraine-bans-41-international-journalists-and-blog.php|archivedate=13 January 2016|df=dmy-all}} The list includes three [[BBC]] journalists, and two Spanish journalists currently missing in [[Syria]], all of whom previously covered the Ukraine crisis.{{cite news|author=Umberto Bacchi|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/ukraine-bbc-boss-slams-shameful-ban-international-journalists-1520086|title=Ukraine: BBC boss slams 'shameful' ban on international journalists|publisher=International Business Times|date=17 September 2015|accessdate=10 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304130055/http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/ukraine-bbc-boss-slams-shameful-ban-international-journalists-1520086|archivedate=4 March 2016|df=dmy-all}} ====International trips==== {{main|List of presidential trips made by Petro Poroshenko}} ==Panama Papers== {{Main|Panama Papers|List of people named in the Panama Papers}} Poroshenko set up an [[offshore company]] in the British Virgin Islands during the peak of the [[war in Donbass]].{{cite news|first1=Pavel|last1=Polityuk|first2=Alessandra|last2=Prentice|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-panama-tax-ukraine-idUSKCN0X1158|title=Ukraine's Poroshenko defends record after Panama leaks|publisher=Reuters|date=4 April 2016|accessdate=7 April 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160407085008/http://www.reuters.com/article/us-panama-tax-ukraine-idUSKCN0X1158|archivedate=7 April 2016|df=dmy-all}} Leaked documents from the Panama Papers show that Poroshenko registered the company, Prime Asset Partners Ltd, on 21 August 2014. Records in Cyprus show him as the firm's only shareholder.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/apr/04/panama-papers-ukraine-petro-poroshenko-secret-offshore-firm-russia|title=Ukraine's leader set up secret offshore firm as battle raged with Russia|work=Guardian|date=4 April 2016|accessdate=7 April 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160407003306/http://www.theguardian.com/news/2016/apr/04/panama-papers-ukraine-petro-poroshenko-secret-offshore-firm-russia|archivedate=7 April 2016|df=dmy-all}} He said that he had done nothing wrong, and the legal firm, Avellum, overseeing the sale of [[Roshen]], Poroshenko's confectionery company, said that "any allegations of tax evasion are groundless". The anti-corruption group [[Transparency International]] believes that the "creation of businesses while serving as president is a direct violation of the constitution".{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-35958762|title=Panama Papers: Ukraine President Poroshenko denies tax claims|work=BBC News|date=4 April 2016|accessdate=7 April 2016}} His name was cited in [[List of people and organisations named in the Paradise Papers|the list of politicians named in]] "[[Paradise Papers]]" allegations.{{Cite news|url=https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/explore-politicians-paradise-papers/|title=Explore The Politicians in the Paradise Papers - ICIJ|work=ICIJ|access-date=2017-12-06|language=en-US}} ==Personal life== [[File:The President's family on the 27th anniversary of Ukraine's Independence - 2018.jpg|thumb|Maryna Poroshenko (in blue) with some of the couple's children on Ukraine's 27th Independence day]] Poroshenko has been married to Maryna since 1984.{{cite web|author1=Tadeusz A. Olszański|author2=Agata Wierzbowska-Miazga|url=http://www.osw.waw.pl/en/publikacje/analyses/2014-05-28/poroshenko-president-ukraine|title=Poroshenko, President of Ukraine|publisher=OSW, Poland|date=28 May 2014|accessdate=10 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160308061143/http://www.osw.waw.pl/en/publikacje/analyses/2014-05-28/poroshenko-president-ukraine|archivedate=8 March 2016|df=dmy-all}} The couple have four children: [[Olexiy Poroshenko|Olexiy]] (born 1985), the twins Yevheniya and Oleksandra (born 2000) and Mykhaylo (born 2001). [[Olexiy Poroshenko|Olexiy]] was a representative in the regional parliament of [[Vinnytsia Oblast]]. In November 2014, he became People's Deputy of Ukraine.{{cite web|url=https://sputniknews.com/politics/201410281014054950/|author=Sputnik|publisher=sputniknews.com|title=Poroshenko's Son Becomes Ukrainian Parliament Member: Election Commission|accessdate=2016-12-13|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220123907/https://sputniknews.com/politics/201410281014054950/|archivedate=20 December 2016|df=dmy-all}} Maryna Poroshenko is a cardiologist, who does not take part in public life, apart from her participation in the activities of the Petro Poroshenko Charity Foundation. Poroshenko became a grandfather on the day of his presidential inauguration of 7 June 2014.{{cite news|script-title=uk:Порошенко став дідом|trans-title=Poroshenko has become a grandfather|newspaper=[[Ukrayinska Pravda]]|url=http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2014/06/7/7028425/|date=7 June 2014|accessdate=7 June 2014|language=uk|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140608032422/http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2014/06/7/7028425/|archivedate=8 June 2014|df=dmy-all}} Poroshenko is a member of the [[Ukrainian Orthodox Church (Kiev Patriarchate)|Ukrainian Orthodox Church]]. Poroshenko has financed the restoration of its buildings and monasteries.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/may/23/petro-poroshenko-heads-landslide-ukraine-election |title=Chocolate tycoon heads for landslide victory in Ukraine presidential election |author=Luke Harding and Oksana Grytsenko |work=[[The Guardian]] |date=23 May 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140609171626/http://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/may/23/petro-poroshenko-heads-landslide-ukraine-election |archivedate=9 June 2014 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}
{{cite news|url=http://ukrainianweek.com/Politics/46136 |title=The Return of the Prodigal Son, Who Never Left Home |publisher=[[The Ukrainian Week]] |date=30 March 2012 |accessdate=17 June 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131030002842/http://ukrainianweek.com/Politics/46136 |archivedate=30 October 2013 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}
{{cite news|url=http://www.day.kiev.ua/en/article/society/who-will-lead-ukrainian-orthodox-church-moscow-patriarchate-and-where |title=Who will lead Ukrainian Orthodox Church (Moscow Patriarchate) and where? |newspaper=[[Den (newspaper)|Den]] |date=27 February 2014 |accessdate=17 June 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140228063016/http://www.day.kiev.ua/en/article/society/who-will-lead-ukrainian-orthodox-church-moscow-patriarchate-and-where |archivedate=28 February 2014 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} In high-level meetings he is often seen with a [[crucifix]]. Poroshenko speaks fluent [[Ukrainian language|Ukrainian]], [[Russian Language|Russian]], [[English Language|English]] and [[Romanian language|Romanian]].{{Citation needed|date=October 2018}} Petro Poroshenko is [[diabetes|diabetic]].{{cite web|url=https://themoscowtimes.com/articles/who-does-putin-want-as-ukrainian-president-32765|title=Who Does Putin Want as Ukrainian President?|publisher=|accessdate=26 November 2018}} ==Cultural and political image== [[File:Petro Poroshenko addresses Euromaidan.jpg|thumb|Poroshenko on stage speaking to [[Euromaidan]] protesters on 8 December 2013.]] He was also nicknamed 'Chocolate King' because of his ownership of a [[Roshen|large confectionery business]]. Poroshenko objected to being called an [[Business oligarch|oligarch]], stating that "Oligarchs are people who seek power in order to further enrich themselves. But I have long fought against bandits who are robbing our country and have destroyed free enterprise". After promising during his election campaign to sell his business assets when elected as the [[president of Ukraine]], according to Poroshenko (and [[N M Rothschild & Sons|Rothschild Wealth Management & Trust]]) since becoming President of Ukraine he has relinquished the management of his businesses, ultimately (in January 2016) to a [[blind trust]]. ===Potential implementation of martial law=== During his speeches Petro Poroshenko on numerous occasions has called [[war in Donbass|the war in East Ukraine]] a 'Patriotic War',[https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2014/08/24/7035656/ Poroshenko: this war will enter the history as patriotic (Порошенко: Ця війна увійде в історію як вітчизняна)]. [[Ukrayinska Pravda]]. 24 August 2014[https://web.archive.org/web/20141006160959/https://tvi.ua/new/2014/10/04/sohodni_v_ukrayini_yde_vitchyznyana_viyna_2014_roku___poroshenko_video Today in Ukraine takes place the 2014 Patriotic War, – Poroshenko (Сьогодні в Україні йде вітчизняна війна 2014 року, – Порошенко)]. TVi. 4 October 2014[https://www.radiosvoboda.org/a/26661001.html Poroshenko: I believe in a victory of the 2014 Patriotic War (Порошенко: вірю у перемогу у Вітчизняній війні 2014 року)]. [[Radio Liberty]]. 28 October 2014 yet did not initiate implementation of martial law, for which he was criticized on numerous occasions by politicians and the general public.[https://www.bbc.com/ukrainian/politics/2014/08/140828_experts_on_martial_law_vs Is there a need to implement a martial law? (Чи треба запроваджувати воєнний стан?)] [[BBC]] Ukraine. 28 August 2014[http://vgolos.com.ua/news/maydan_ta_batalyony_vymagayut_vid_poroshenka_zaprovadyty_voiennyy_stan_na_donbasi_149795.html Maidan and battalions are requesting for Poroshenko to implement martial law in Donbas (Майдан та батальйони вимагають від Порошенка запровадити воєнний стан на Донбасі)]. Vgolos. 29 June 2014 Poroshenko noted that it is necessary to realize the consequences of martial law for the country: * it will restrict the supply of weaponry and items of dual assignment; * the [[International Monetary Fund|IMF]] won't provide funds to countries that are in war.[http://uapress.info/uk/news/show/32050 Poroshenko explained why cannot implement martial law (Порошенко пояснив, чому не можна вводити воєнний стан)]. UApress. 23 July 2014 A month later the last statement was refuted by a head of the IMF Ukrainian branch Jerome Vacher, "As for the possible introduction of martial law, the IMF has no formal legal restrictions that impede continuation of mutual cooperation under such conditions. We have already worked with a number of countries where war conflicts of various intensity unfolded".[https://ukr.media/ukrain/214620/ IMF will continue support for Ukraine in case of introduction of martial law (МВФ продовжить підтримку України в разі введення воєнного стану)]. Ukr.media. 29 October 2014 On 5 February 2015 in his interview with the Spanish [[El Pais]], Poroshenko stated that he will introduce martial law in the case of an escalation of the situation in Donbas, but that that decision will limit democracy and liberties as well as threaten the development of the economy.[https://lb.ua/news/2015/02/05/294580_poroshenko_obyavit_voennoe_polozhenie.html (Порошенко объявит военное положение в случае эскалации конфликта)]. LB.ua. 5 February 2015[https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2015/02/5/7057583/ Poroshenko: if conflict will expand, there may be a martial law across whole country (Порошенко: Якщо конфлікт наростатиме, може бути воєнний стан по всій країні)]. [[Ukrayinska Pravda]]. 5 February 2015 Poroshenko stands after the murder of journalist [[Olesy Buzina]]. ===Energy sector=== ====Coal from South Africa==== ===Connections with Dmytro Firtash=== In April 2015 Ukrainian oligarch [[Dmytro Firtash]] at a court session about his extradition to the United States stated that at the [[Ukrainian presidential election, 2014|Ukrainian presidential election]] he financially supported Poroshenko,[https://zn.ua/POLITICS/firtash-my-poluchili-poroshenko-prezidentom-klichko-merom-kak-i-hoteli-174844_.html Firtash: We got Poroshenko as a president, Klychko as a mayor as we all wanted (Фирташ: Мы получили Порошенко президентом, Кличко - мэром, как и хотели)]. [[Mirror Weekly]]. 30 April 2015 and at the Kiev city mayor election – [[Vitaliy Klychko]]. ===Mikheil Saakashvili=== On 29 May 2015 [[President of Ukraine]] Petro Poroshenko granted a Ukrainian citizenship to former [[President of Georgia]] [[Mikheil Saakashvili]] almost 10 months after a Tbilisi city court approved the request of the General Prosecutor of Georgia's office and elected a pre-trial detention for Saakashvili in absentia as preventative measure.[https://news.rambler.ru/caucasus/26237159-sud-tbilisi-zaochno-arestoval-eks-prezidenta-gruzii-saakashvili/ Mass media: Tbilisi court arrested the former president of Georgia Saakshvili in absentia (СМИ: суд Тбилиси заочно арестовал экс-президента Грузии Саакашвили )]. Rambler. 2 August 2014[https://www.newsru.com/world/02aug2014/saakashv.html The city of Tbilisi court arrested Saakashvili in absentia as well as the former ministers of justice and defense (Горсуд Тбилиси заочно арестовал Саакашвили, а также экс-министров юстиции и обороны)]. Newsru. 2 August 2014 The reason for granting the citizenship was acknowledging that it "poses a state interest of Ukraine".Poroshenko, P. [https://web.archive.org/web/20150602040433/http://www.president.gov.ua/documents/19531.html "About granting a Ukrainian citizenship to Saakashvili M. as a person granting whom the citizenship of Ukraine poses a state interest for Ukraine (Про прийняття до громадянства України Саакашвілі М. як особи, прийняття якої до громадянства України становить державний інтерес для України)"]. Presidential ukase № 301/2015. 29 May 2015 In February 2015 the General Prosecutor of Georgia's office had appealed to the [[General Prosecutor of Ukraine]] office for extradition of Saakashvili. The [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Georgia]] had also recalled the [[Ukraine Ambassador to Georgia]], in relation to Saakashvili's appointment as a chairman of Consultative International Council of Reforms.[https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2015/02/17/7058884/ Ukraine has denied Georgia extradition of Saakashvili (Україна відмовила Грузії в екстрадиції Саакашвілі)]. [[Ukrayinska Pravda]]. 17 February 2015 Later during his visit to Georgia in 2017, President Poroshenko at his briefing in Tbilisi stated that Ukraine has never received any requests for extradition of Saakashvili, while Minister of Justice of Georgia [[Tea Tsulukiani]] countered it with the announcement that there were actually two official requests.[https://hromadske.ua/posts/hruziia-dvichi-zvertalas-do-ukrainy-shchodo-ekstradytsii-saakashvili Georgia has asked Ukraine twice to give away Saakashvili – Ministry of Justice of Georgia (Грузія двічі просила Україну видати Саакашвілі — Мінюст Грузії)]. [[Hromadske]]. 19 July 2017 The very next day after receiving citizenship on 30 May 2015 Saakashvili was appointment by the president as a head (governor) of the Odessa Regional State Administration (see [[Governor of Odessa Oblast]]).Poroshenko, P. ''About appointment of M.Saakashvili as a head of Odessa Oblast State Administration''. Presidential ukase № 304/2015. 30 May 2015 ===Valeriya Gontaryeva=== ===New year vacationing (2018)=== In January 2018 journalists from [[Radio Free Europe]] reported that during Poroshenko's New Year's vacation starting 1 January 2018 on the [[Maldives]] there were 10 people who spent $500 000, rented separate islands and the most expensive hotel in the country.{{Cite web|url=https://www.radiosvoboda.org/a/news-schemes/28983638.html|title=Mr. Petro Incognito. Таємна відпустка президента Порошенка (розслідування)|last=|first=|date=|website=Радіо Свобода|language=uk|access-date=2018-04-06}}{{Cite news|url=http://ua.interfax.com.ua/news/general/477347.html|title=Порошенко на новорічні свята був у Києві, Івано-Франківську та на Мальдівах|access-date=2018-04-06|language=uk}} On 30 March 2018 Poroshenko submitted his income declaration. Poroshenko declared that he spent between 1.3 and 1.4 million UAH on this vacation – two times less than journalists had reported (some details about the president's vacation were classified).{{Cite web|url=https://public.nazk.gov.ua/declaration/c9e4d7dd-d6b7-44b8-9e26-12e756d36e04|title=Перегляд декларації {{!}} ЄДИНИЙ ДЕРЖАВНИЙ РЕЄСТР ДЕКЛАРАЦІЙ|website=public.nazk.gov.ua|language=en|access-date=2018-04-06}} ===Awards=== * {{flag|Ukraine}} : [[Order of Merit (Ukraine)|Order of Merit]] * {{flag|Moldova}} : [[Order of the Republic (Moldova)|Order of the Republic]] * {{flag|Poland}} : [[Order of the White Eagle (Poland)|Order of the White Eagle]] * {{flag|Spain}} : [[Order of Civil Merit]] * {{flag|Ukraine}} : Medal of winner of revision.text:
{{Infobox writer | name = Rae Spoon | image = Rae-Spoon-Nov-2013.jpg | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Calgary]], [[Alberta]] | occupation = [[Singer-songwriter]], short story writer | period = 1990s-present | nationality = [[Canadian]] | notableworks = ''First Grass Spring Fire'', ''superioryouareinferior'', ''My Prairie Home'' | spouse = | website = {{url|http://www.raespoon.com/}} }}
'''Rae Spoon''' is a [[Canadian]] musician and writer. Their musical style has varied from [[country music|country]] to electronic-influenced [[indie rock]] and [[folk punk]].<ref name=longview>[http://www.exclaim.ca/articles/multiarticlesub.aspx?csid1=126&csid2=4&fid1=33965 Rae Spoon's Long View]. ''[[Exclaim!]]'', October 2008.</ref>
==Personal life==
Spoon grew up as a [[transgender]] person in [[Calgary]], Alberta. They were raised in a Pentecostal household to a paranoid-schizophrenic father. Their father's religious beliefs caused anxiety to a teenage Rae. Spoon now lives in [[Victoria, British Columbia|Victoria]], British Columbia.
After a decade of living as a [[trans man]],<ref name="see">{{citation |title=He said/she said? |accessdate=2007-09-22 |url=http://www.seemagazine.com/Issues/2003/0508/mus1.htm |date=2003-05-08 |periodical=[[SEE Magazine]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071022043241/http://seemagazine.com/Issues/2003/0508/mus1.htm |archivedate=2007-10-22 |df= }}</ref> Spoon noted a preference for the pronoun "they" in 2012 during an interview with cartoonist [[Elisha Lim]], a fellow advocate for the [[gender-neutral pronoun]].<ref>[http://nomorepotlucks.org/site/elisha-lim-and-rae-spoon-talking-shop "Elisha Lim and Rae Spoon: Talking Shop"]. ''No More Potlucks'', January 2012.</ref> They explained to ''[[Now (newspaper)|Now Magazine]]'', "after years of fighting to be called 'he,' the idea of coming out again made me tired. But now I feel kind of rejuvenated, ready to fight on some more. I think the 'they' pronoun is a pretty cool thing. It's letting a lot of people not have to identify as a man or a woman. Whatever it means to them."<ref name="nowtoronto.com">[http://www.nowtoronto.com/music/story.cfm?content=184903 "Rae Spoon: Powerful album reignites the pronoun debate"]. ''[[Now (newspaper)|NOW]]'', January 26, 2012.</ref>
==Career== {{Quote box |quote = How do you become a transgender country singer? For some, it's easier to be transgender from the start,and then work towards becoming a singer. For others it is better to play music first, and then come out as transgender. About ten years ago, I managed to do both in the space of a few months. |author = Rae Spoon<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Perschbacher|first1=Shana-Goldin|title=|journal=New Literary History|date=Autumn 2015|volume=46|issue=4|pages=775–803|doi=10.1353/nlh.2015.0041|url=https://muse.jhu.edu/article/611660|accessdate=13 March 2018}}</ref> |width = 20% |source = }} Spoon started performing before they started recording. They decided they wanted to become a [[Singer-songwriter|songwriter]] while performing at the age of seventeen.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=King|first1=Moynan|title=Canada's Dandy Duet: The Performance Collaboration of Ivan Coyote and Rae Spoon|journal=Canadian Theatre Review|date=January 18, 2012|volume=149|pages=46–51|doi=10.3138/ctr.149.46}} See p. 48.</ref> They emerged as a [[Country music|country]] and [[Roots rock|roots]] singer. Their early music features country imagery to the sound of acoustic string instruments such as [[banjo]], [[guitar]] and [[mandolin]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=McPherson|first1=David|title=Your Trailer Door|url=http://exclaim.ca/Music/article/rae_spoon-your_trailer_door|website=exclaim|publisher=Ian Danzig|accessdate=17 April 2015}}</ref>
Spoon has performed with such artists as [[Annabelle Chvostek]], [[Ember Swift]], [[Kinnie Starr]], [[Melissa Ferrick]], [[The Be Good Tanyas]], [[Bitch and Animal|Bitch & Animal]], [[Natalie Merchant]] and [[Earl Scruggs]].<ref name="xtra.ca">[http://www.xtra.ca/public/Vancouver/Rae_Spoon_offers_an_affectionate_homage_to_another_era-706.aspx "Rae Spoon offers an affectionate homage to another era"]. ''[[Xtra!]]'', July 7, 2005.</ref> They have performed at festivals including [[Music of Alberta|North Country Fair, South Country Fair]], [[Under the Volcano Festival]], and the [[Vancouver Folk Music Festival|Vancouver]],<ref name="xtra.ca"/> [[Regina Folk Festival|Regina]], [[Ottawa Folk Festival|Ottawa]], [[Calgary Folk Music Festival|Calgary]], [[Edmonton Folk Music Festival|Edmonton]], [[Brandon, Manitoba|Brandon Folk, Music & Art Festival]] and [[Winnipeg Folk Festival|Winnipeg]] folk festivals.
Spoon's breakthrough album, 2008's ''Superioryouareinferior'', was recorded in [[Calgary]] and introduced some [[electronic music]] elements into Spoon's style.<ref name=longview /> ''Superioryouareinferior'' includes themes previously used by Spoon like [[Canadian history]] and [[Canadian culture|culture]] such as the commentary on [[colonialism]] in their song "Come On Forest Fire Burn The Disco Down".<ref>{{cite web|last1=Ash|first1=Amanda|title=Superioryouareinferior|url=http://exclaim.ca/Music/article/rae_spoon-superioryouareinferior|website=Exclaim!|publisher=Ian Danzig|accessdate=17 April 2015}}</ref> ''Superioryouareinferior'' was a longlisted nominee for the [[2009 Polaris Music Prize]].<ref>[http://exclaim.ca/articles/multiarticlesub.aspx?csid1=147&csid2=4&fid1=49036 "Pop goes Rae Spoon"]. ''[[Exclaim!]]'', September 2010.</ref>
While touring Europe Spoon met Alexandre Decoupigny in [[Berlin]]. Decoupigny and Spoon collaborated in the album ''Worauf Wartest Du?''<ref>{{cite web|last1=Angus|first1=Mike|title=On The Hunt|url=http://www.vueweekly.com/on_the_hunt2/|website=Vue Weekly|publisher=Aberdeen|accessdate=17 April 2015}}</ref> Decoupigny taught Spoon how to create music with a computer which inspired the musician to further experiment with [[electronic music]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Hudson|first1=Alex|title=Rae Spoon Talks 'I Can't Keep All of Our Secrets,' Reveals New Track and Canadian Tour|url=http://exclaim.ca/Music/article/rae_spoon_talks_new_album_reveals_new_track_canadian_tour_dates|website=Exclaim!|publisher=Ian Danzig|accessdate=17 April 2015}}</ref> The experimentation with [[electronic music]] influenced their subsequent albums and culminated in ''I Can't Keep All Our Secrets''.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Adams|first1=Gregory|title=Rae Spoon Announces 'I Can't Keep All of Our Secrets'|url=http://exclaim.ca/Music/article/rae_spoon_announces_i_cant_keep_all_of_our_secrets|website=Exclaim!|publisher=Ian Danzig|accessdate=17 April 2015}}</ref>
They have also published ''First Spring Grass Fire'', a book of short stories about growing up in Alberta. [[Arsenal Pulp Press]] released the book in the fall of 2012.<ref name="nowtoronto.com"/> The book was a nominee for the [[2013 Lambda Literary Awards]] in the Transgender Fiction category,<ref>[http://www.quillandquire.com/blog/index.php/awards/rae-spoon-kamal-al-solaylee-among-canadian-lambda-nominees/ "Rae Spoon, Kamal Al-Solaylee among Canadian Lambda nominees"]. ''[[Quill & Quire]]'', March 6, 2013.</ref> and Spoon was awarded an Honour of Distinction from the [[Dayne Ogilvie Prize]] for LGBT writers in 2014.<ref>[http://www.writerstrust.com/awards/dayne-ogilvie-grant.aspx Dayne Ogilvie Prize], [[Writers' Trust of Canada]].</ref>
Spoon has stated that ''First Spring Grass Fire'' was written to help them prepare for the production of a [[National Film Board of Canada]] documentary about their life and music, ''[[My Prairie Home (film)|My Prairie Home]]'', directed by [[Chelsea McMullan]]. The film was released in the fall of 2013.<ref name="Kelly">{{cite news|url=http://www.montrealgazette.com/entertainment/movie-guide/Spoon+different+nature+proud/9278484/story.html|title=Rae Spoon is different by nature, and proud of it|last=Kelly|first=Brendan|date=13 December 2013|work=[[Montreal Gazette]]|accessdate=13 December 2013}}</ref><ref name="Lederman">{{cite news|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/arts/film/film-reviews/viff-review-my-prairie-home/article14585191/#dashboard/follows/|title=My Prairie Home|last=Lederman|first=Marsha|date=28 September 2013|work=[[The Globe and Mail]]|accessdate=6 November 2013}}</ref> ''[[My Prairie Home (album)|My Prairie Home]]'', the album of music that Spoon composed for the film, was a longlisted nominee for the [[2014 Polaris Music Prize]].<ref name=longlist>[http://www.aux.tv/2014/06/polaris-music-prize-announces-2014-long-list/ "Polaris Music Prize announces 2014 long list"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140703214135/http://www.aux.tv/2014/06/polaris-music-prize-announces-2014-long-list/ |date=2014-07-03 }}. ''[[Aux (TV channel)|Aux]]'', June 19, 2014.</ref>
In 2012, Spoon and [[Ivan Coyote]] collaborated on ''Gender Failure'', a touring [[multimedia]] show in which both artists performed music and [[spoken word]] pieces about their failed attempts at fitting into the gender binary.<ref>[[Richard Burnett]], [http://blogs.montrealgazette.com/2012/11/20/queer-icons-ivan-e-coyote-and-rae-spoon-step-out-of-the-box-for-gender-failure-show/ "Queer icons Ivan E. Coyote and Rae Spoon step "out of the box" for Gender Failure Show"]. ''[[The Gazette (Montreal)|The Gazette]]'', November 20, 2012.</ref> A book based on the show was published by Arsenal Pulp in 2014.<ref>[http://www.quillandquire.com/authors/2014/06/20/rae-spoon-and-ivan-e-coyote-share-personal-stories-in-gender-failure/ "Rae Spoon and Ivan E. Coyote share personal stories in Gender Failure"]. ''[[Quill & Quire]]'', June 20, 2014.</ref>
In 2014, Spoon composed music for the feature film ''[[The Valley Below]]''.<ref>[https://nowtoronto.com/music/best-original-scores/ "Best Original Scores: TIFF tips for music lovers"]. ''[[Now (newspaper)|Now]]'', September 4, 2014.</ref>
Spoon began the music label Coax Records "out of a love for indie music and as an answer to under representation for many groups in the music industry."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.coaxrecords.com/label/about/|title=About Label - Coax Records|work=Coax Records|access-date=2018-09-14|language=en-US}}</ref> The album "Armour" was released on Coax in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://exclaim.ca/music/article/rae_spoon_returns_with_armour_lp|title=Rae Spoon Returns with 'Armour'|website=exclaim.ca|language=en|access-date=2018-09-14}}</ref>
==Discography== * ''Honking at Minivans'' (2001) * ''Throw Some Dirt on Me'' (2003) * ''Your Trailer Door'' (2005) * ''White Hearse Comes Rolling'' (2006) * ''Trucker's Memorial'' (2006, with [[Rodney Decroo]]) * ''superioryouareinferior'' (2008) * ''Worauf wartest du?'' (2009, with Alexandre Decoupigny) * ''Love Is a Hunter'' (2010) * ''I Can't Keep All of Our Secrets'' (2012) * ''[[My Prairie Home (album)|My Prairie Home]]'' (2013) * ''Armour'' (2016) * ''bodiesofwater'' (2018)
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
==External links== * {{official website|http://www.raespoon.com/}} * [http://radio3.cbc.ca/bands/Rae-Spoon Rae Spoon] at [[CBC Radio 3]] * {{IMDb name|2872795}}
{{Dayne Ogilvie Prize}} {{Authority control}}

{{EngvarB|date=August 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2017}} {{Infobox scientist | honorific_prefix = | name = Redcliffe N. Salaman | honorific_suffix = | native_name = | native_name_lang = he | image = | image_size = | image_upright = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Redcliffe Nathan Salaman | birth_date = {{Birth date|1874|9|12|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Kensington, London|Kensington]], [[London]], [[England]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1955|6|12|1874|9|12|df=y}} | death_place = | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | other_names = | pronounce = | residence = | citizenship = | nationality = | fields = | workplaces = | patrons = | education = [[St Paul's School, London|St Paul's School]] | alma_mater = [[Trinity Hall, Cambridge]] | thesis_title = | thesis_url = | thesis_year = | doctoral_advisor = | academic_advisors = | doctoral_students = | notable_students = | known_for = | influences = | influenced = | awards = | author_abbrev_bot = | author_abbrev_zoo = | spouse = {{marriage|[[Nina Ruth Davis Salaman|Nina Ruth Davis]]|1901|1925|reason=her death}}
{{marriage|Gertrude Lowy|1926}} | partner = | children = 6, including [[Raphael Salaman]] (son) and [[Esther Salaman (singer)|Esther Salaman]] (daughter) | signature = | signature_alt = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Redcliffe Nathan Salaman''' (12 September 1874 – 12 June 1955) was a [[United Kingdom|British]] [[botanist]] and potato breeder.{{Cite journal | last1 = Smith | first1 = K. M. | doi = 10.1098/rsbm.1955.0017 | title = Redcliffe Nathan Salaman. 1874-1955 | journal = Biographical Memoirs of Fellows of the Royal Society | volume = 1 | pages = 238–245| year = 1955 }} His landmark work was the 1949 book on the ''History and Social influence of the Potato'', a book that established the history of nutrients as a new literary genre.{{cite book |last=Niemann|first=Hans-Joachim|title=Karl Popper and the Two New Secrets of Life|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=RTPpiAMuZRcC&pg=PA39|year=2014|publisher=[[Mohr Siebeck]]|page=39|isbn=978-3161532078}} ==Background== [[File:Myer_Salaman_bust.jpg|thumb|Bust of Salaman's mother Sarah]] Salaman was born in [[Kensington, London|Kensington]], [[London]] and was the ninth of fifteen children born to his parents Sarah Solomon and Myer Salaman who was a wealthy merchant who traded in ostrich feathers at the height of the [[Plume hunting|plume trade]].{{cite web|url=http://www.oxforddnb.com/view/printable/35911|title=Salaman, Redcliffe Nathan (1874–1955), geneticist and Jewish activist|author=Paolo Palladino|work=Oxford Dictionary of National Biography}} The Salaman family are [[Ashkenazi Jews]],{{cite news |last=Morrison|first=Blake|url=https://www.theguardian.com/books/2003/oct/11/featuresreviews.guardianreview2|title=Generation gap|work= |location= |publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''|date=11 October 2013|accessdate=1 July 2018}} who according to Salaman, migrated to Britain from either [[Holland]] or the [[Rhineland]] in the early 18th century.{{cite book |last=Stein|first=Sarah Abrevaya|title=Plumes: Ostrich Feathers, Jews, and a Lost World of Global Commerce|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=ikHj7Xc9lJUC&pg=PA180&lpg=PA180|year=2010|publisher=[[Yale University Press]]|page=180|isbn=978-0300168181}} ==Education== Salaman was educated at [[St Paul's School, London]] initially studying [[classics]] but due to the dull teaching methods he switched to studying science and later became head boy of the Science Side of the school. He obtained a scholarship at [[Trinity Hall, Cambridge]] in 1893 and graduated with a first class degree in Natural Sciences in 1896 having studied physiology, zoology and chemistry. He was tutored and advised by the physiologist [[W. H. Gaskell]] who later became a good friend of Salaman. He moved to the [[London Hospital]] in 1896 to study medicine and remained there until he qualified in 1900. ==Research== In 1903, Salaman was appointed Director of the Pathological Institute at the London Hospital but in 1904 he developed [[tuberculosis]] and had to stop practising medicine and spend six months in a Swiss [[sanitorium]].{{cite book|author=John Reader|title=The Untold History of the Potato|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=LAM4s6arkhsC|year=2009|publisher=Vintage|isbn=978-0-09-947479-1|pages=221–225}} It took him over two years to fully recover from the illness, changing the course of his entire life. He purchased a house in [[Barley, Hertfordshire]] and because he could not return to practising medicine began experimenting in the emerging science of [[genetics]] under the guidance of his friend [[William Bateson]]. After several failed experiments with a range of animals, Salaman decided to experiment with potatoes after seeking advice from his gardener. Later in his career, commenting on his decision to study potatoes Salaman noted that he had "embarked on an enterprise which, after forty years, leaves more questions unsolved than were thought at that time to exist. Whether it was mere luck, or whether the potato and I were destined for life partnership, I do not know, but from that moment my course was set, and I became ever more involved in problems associated directly or indirectly with a plant with which I had no particular affinity, gustatory or romantic". Working in his private garden, he initially set out to cross two potato varieties and establish which traits were [[dominance (genetics)|dominant]] and [[recessive (genetics)|recessive]] in a similar manner to [[Gregor Mendel]]'s work on peas, but he soon broadened into other areas. In 1908, he decided to include wild potatoes in his experiments and requested that [[Kew Gardens]] provide him with ''[[Solanum maglia]]''. Kew's stocks had been incorrectly labelled however and Salaman was sent ''[[Solanum edinense]]'' instead. In 1909, Salaman grew 40 self-fertilised crosses of ''S. edinense'' and found that seven of them did not succumb to [[late blight]] (''Phytophthora infestans''). Convinced that resistance to late blight existed in wild species he began to study other species and found that ''[[Solanum demissum]]'' was also resistant to blight. Salaman started to cross ''S. demissum'' with domesticated varieties of potato in 1911 to produce high yielding lines that were also resistant to late blight. By 1914, he had successfully created hybrids and in 1926 he remarked that he had produced varieties with "reasonably good economic characteristics which, no matter what their maturity, appeared to be immune to late blight. Salaman was the first to identify genetic resistance to late blight and ''S. demissum'' was still used as a source of resistance in the 1950s. In ''[[The Propitious Esculent]]'', John Reader called Salaman's discovery "an important breakthrough, offering real promise ... that it was possible to breed blight-resistant potato varieties". In 1987, it was thought that half of the potato varieties cultivated in Europe contained genes from ''S. demissum''.{{Cite journal | doi = 10.2307/2806972| jstor = 2806972| title = The History and Social Influence of the Potato| journal = Brittonia| volume = 39| pages = 48| year = 1987| last1 = Nee | first1 = M. | last2 = Salaman | first2 = R. N.| last3 = Hawkes | first3 = J. G.}} In 1910, he published a paper the inheritance of colour in potato in the first issue of the ''[[Journal of Genetics]]''.{{Cite journal | doi = 10.1007/BF02981567| title = The inheritance of colour and other characters in the potato| journal = Journal of Genetics| volume = 1| pages = 7| year = 1910| last1 = Salaman | first1 = R. N. }} Later papers in the ''[[The Journal of Agricultural Science|Journal of Agricultural Science]]'' examined [[male sterility]],{{Cite journal | doi = 10.1017/S0021859600004512| title = Genetic studies in potatoes; sterility| journal = Journal of Agricultural Science| volume = 12| pages = 31| year = 1923| last1 = Salaman | first1 = R. N.| last2 = Lesley | first2 = J. W.}} methods for estimating yields{{Cite journal | doi = 10.1017/S0021859600003816| title = The determination of the best method for estimating potato yields, together with a further note on the influence of size of seed on the character and yield of the potato. III| journal = Journal of Agricultural Science| volume = 13| issue = 4| pages = 361| year = 1923| last1 = Salaman | first1 = R. N. }} and detecting viruses in seed potatoes{{Cite journal | doi = 10.1017/S0021859600018803| title = A note on the production of premature sprouting in the potato, and its application to the study of virus diseases| journal = Journal of Agricultural Science| volume = 17| issue = 4| pages = 524| year = 1927| last1 = Salaman | first1 = R. N. }} and a study of how the size of seed tubers affected the yield and size of tubers of the crop.{{Cite journal | doi = 10.1017/S0021859600004901| title = The Influence of size and character of seed on the yield of potatoes| journal = Journal of Agricultural Science| volume = 12| issue = 2| pages = 182| year = 1922| last1 = Salaman | first1 = R. N. }} He wrote the book ''Potato Varieties'' in 1929. His research on potatoes was disrupted by the outbreak of the [[First World War]] during which Salaman joined the [[Royal Army Medical Corps]] and served in [[Palestine (region)|Palestine]]. Afterwards he was appointed chairman of the potato synonym committee at the [[National Institute of Agricultural Botany]] where he was tasked with describing potato varieties and putting an end to the common practice of marketing old and unreliable varieties under new names. His work there culminated in the publication of ''Potato Varieties'' in 1926. The same year he persuaded the [[Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food (United Kingdom)|Ministry of Agriculture]] to establish the Potato Virus Research Institute in Cambridge of which he remained a director until 1939. [[Kenneth Manley Smith]] was an entomologist at the institute and [[:de:Frederick Bawden|Frederick Charles Bawden]] became Salaman's assistant in 1930. Smith and Bawden went on to become renowned plant virologists.{{cite book|author=Geoffrey Clough Ainsworth|title=Introduction to the History of Plant Pathology|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=j-s8AAAAIAAJ&pg=PA83|year=1981|publisher=Cambridge University Press|isbn=978-0-521-23032-2|pages=84–85}} In conjunction with [[Paul A. Murphy]] of [[Dublin]] a large stock of virus-free potatoes was built up and multiplied in greenhouses, a practice which continued after his death and was adopted in other countries. His research on viruses lead to him being elected to the [[Royal Society]] in 1935. Salaman supervised the PhD thesis of [[Jack Hawkes (botanist)|Jack Hawkes]], who went on to become an authority in the taxonomy of wild potato species and identified sources of resistance to [[potato cyst nematode]]s.{{Cite journal | doi = 10.1007/s10722-005-8253-3|author=Richard N. Lester|title=Book Review - Hunting the Wild Potato in the South American Andes: Memories of the British Empire Potato Collecting Expedition to South America 1938–1939|journal=Genetic Resources and Crop Evolution|year=2005|volume=52|pages=483–488}} ==''The History and Social Influence of the Potato''== Salaman authored ''The History and Social Influence of the Potato'' first published in 1949, reprinted in 1970{{cite journal|jstor=30005769|title=Review: The History and Social Influence of the Potato by Redcliffe N. Salaman|author=P. M. Austin Bourke|journal=Irish Historical Studies|volume= 17|year=1971|pages=410–413}} and revised under the guidance of Jack Hawkes in 1987. A review of the first edition in the ''[[British Journal of Sociology]]'' noted that it was an "unusual and vastly interesting book which took nine years to write, and a life-time to prepare" combining genetics, history and archaeology.{{Cite journal | doi = 10.2307/587558| jstor = 587558| title = The History and Social Influence of the Potato| journal = The British Journal of Sociology| volume = 1| issue = 2| pages = 172| year = 1950| last1 = Beales | first1 = H. L.| last2 = Salaman | first2 = R. N. }} The book covers every aspect of the [[history of the potato]] with a particular focus on Ireland about which he wrote "in no other country can [potato's] influence on the domestic and economic life of the people be studied to greater advantage".{{cite news|title=Have we forgotten our roots?|work=The Irish Times|date=6 December 2011|author=John McKenna}} The historian [[Eric Hobsbawm]] referred to the work as "that magnificent monument of scholarship and humanity".{{cite book|author=Redcliffe N. Salaman|title=The History and Social Influence of the Potato|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=EV4YE_0RsywC&pg=PA688|date=21 November 1985|publisher=Cambridge University Press|isbn=978-0-521-31623-1|page=688}} A 1999 paper in ''Potato Research'' noted that because of Salaman's "unprecedented" book, we "know more about the impact of the diffusion of potato on the welfare of people, particularly the poor, than about such consequences following the introduction of any other major food plant."{{Cite journal | doi = 10.1007/BF02357856| title = World trends and patterns in the potato crop: An economic and geographic survey| journal = Potato Research| volume = 42| issue = 2| pages = 241| year = 1999| last1 = Walker | first1 = T. S.| last2 = Schmiediche | first2 = P. E.| last3 = Hijmans | first3 = R. J.}} ==Views== Salaman combined active [[Zionism]] with research into the genetics and social history of the potato, which led him to an interest in eugenics and racial explanations for Arab "failure". In 1919, he was uncomfortably conscious that clearing [[Palestine (region)|Palestine]] of Arabs would be "simply ridiculous and comparable to [[Oliver Cromwell|Cromwell]]'s effort in Ireland", and the chief moral he drew from [[the Holocaust]] was the peril of attributing misfortune to racial characteristics rather than political oppression.{{cite news |last=FitzHerbert|first=Claudia|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/books/3604881/Plundering-the-past-with-the-verve-of-an-angry-child.html|title=Plundering the past with the verve of an angry child|work= |location= |publisher=''[[The Daily Telegraph]]''|date=21 October 2003|accessdate=1 July 2018}} ==Personal life== On 23 October 1901, first to [[Hebrew language|Hebrew]] scholar [[Nina Ruth Davis Salaman|Nina Ruth Davis]], whom he had met four months earlier at the [[New West End Synagogue]]. They were engaged ten days after meeting. After living in [[Berlin]] for several months, while Redcliffe completed advanced training in pathology, they returned to London, where he assumed the directorship of the Pathological Institute at the London Hospital.{{cite web |last=Endelman|first=Todd M.|url=https://www.jwa.org/encyclopedia/article/salaman-nina-ruth-davis|title=Nina Ruth Davis Salaman|publisher=Jewish Women's Archive|date= |accessdate=1 July 2018}} They had six children including a cancer researcher, a doctor, the engineer [[Raphael Salaman]], the artist [[Ruth Collet]]{{cite news|title=Obituary – Ruth Collet|author= Marion Glastonbury|work=The Independent|date=28 June 2001}} and the singer [[Esther Salaman (singer)|Esther Salaman]].{{cite news |last=Miller|first=Jane|url=https://www.guardian.co.uk/news/2005/oct/26/guardianobituaries.artsobituaries1|title=Obituary: Esther Salaman|work= |location= |publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''|date=26 October 2005|accessdate=7 April 2014}} They settled in the country, in the village of Barley in Hertfordshire where they lived with their six children (one of whom died in childhood). Nina Salaman continued to pursue her interest in medieval Hebrew poetry. Despite Barley's distance from London, she maintained a kosher home and [[Sabbath]] observance. For the festivals, the family traveled to London, where they stayed with one of Redcliffe's siblings and worshipped at the [[New West End Synagogue]]. She took personal responsibility for the Hebrew education of her children until they left for boarding school. Salaman's paternal granddaughter is Chair of [[Jewish Voice for Labour]] [[Jenny Manson]].{{cite news |last=Doherty|first=Rosa|url=https://www.thejc.com/news/news-features/jeremy-corbyn-s-devoted-defender-jewish-voice-for-labour-jenny-manson-1.465660|title=Meet Jeremy Corbyn’s devoted Jewish defender: Jenny Manson|work= |location= |publisher=''[[The Jewish Chronicle]]''|date=19 June 2018|accessdate=1 July 2018}} In 1925, Salaman's first wife Nina died. In 1926, he met and married Gertrude Lowy who survived him. ==See also== *[[British Jews]] *[[List of British Jewish writers]] ==Further reading== *Daniel Dornhofer: ''[[Palestine (region)|Palestine]] reclaimed. [[Rassekunde]] und [[Sionism|Zionismus]] unter dem Eindruck des [[World War I|Ersten Weltkriegs]],'' in ''transversal. Zeitschrift für jüdische Studien.'' № 2, Year 14, [[University of Graz]] 2013, {{ISSN|1607-629X}} pp. 59 – 75 (in German) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://janus.lib.cam.ac.uk/db/node.xsp?id=EAD%2FGBR%2F0012%2FMS%20Add.8171;sib0=1236 Personal papers of Salaman] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Salaman, Redcliffe N.}} [[Category:1874 births]] [[Category:1955 deaths]] [[Category:English people of Dutch-Jewish descent]] [[Category:English people of German-Jewish descent]] [[Category:English botanists]] [[Category:British Jewish writers]] [[Category:British non-fiction writers]] [[Category:20th-century British non-fiction writers]] [[Category:People with tuberculosis]] [[Category:People from Kensington]] [[Category:Alumni of Trinity Hall, Cambridge]] [[Category:Fellows of the Royal Society]]
